src: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.
mt: Pastikeun tanganmu leuwih rileks mungkin tanpa ngahitkeun not jeung ngalegéngkeun jari-jarimu. Ieu jalan, kalian bakal leuwih lama teu lelah. Ingat, teu perlu ngahitkeun kunci jeung teu loba teu ngahitkeun kunci pikeun volume tambahan saperti di piano. Di akordéon, pikeun volume tambahan, kalian ngagunakeun bellow jeung teu loba teu ngagunakeun bellow.
ref: Pastikeun leungeun anjeun sakumaha tiasa santai bari tetep pencét kabéh nada anu leres - ogé cobi ulah ngadamel seueur gerakan asing sareng ramo anjeun. Ku cara ieu, anjeun bakal capék padahal ngan maén sakedik. Émut, henteu kudu mencet konci sakuat tanaga pikeun nambah suara sapertos dina piano. Dinu akordion, pikeun ngengingkeun volume langkung, anggo bagian handap langkung teuas atanapi langkung enggal.

src: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.
mt: Salahsatu masalah anu paling umum nalika nyoba ngarubah file video jadi format DVD nyaéta overscan. Televisi umumna dipikiran pikeun ngeunahkeun umum. Sabab kitu, sababaraha hal anu dipikiran ku umumna dipotong, di bagian atas, bawah sareng sisi. Ieu dipikirkeun pikeun nyatakeun yén gambar ngahasilkeun layar. Ieu nyaéta overscan. Sayangna, nalika ngarubah file jadi DVD, bordernya ogé bakal dipotong, jeung lamun file video aya subtitek deukeut ka bawah, teu bakal dipaké.
ref: Hiji masalah anu paling umum nalika nyobaan ngarubah pilem kana format DVD nyaéta pemindaian leleuwiheun. Seseueurna tipi didamel pikeun dipikaresep ku masarakat umum. Kusabab alasan éta, sadaya nu anjeun tingal di tipi tos dipotong watesna, luhur, handap, sareng sisina. Iyeu dijieun jang mastikeun yen gambar nutupan sakabeh layar. Iyeu disebut overscan. Hanjakalna, nalika anjeun midamel DVD, tepina sigana bakal dipotong ogé, jeung upami videona gaduh terjamahan anu caket pisan ka handapeunna, tarjamahna moal ditampilkeun pinuh.

src: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.
mt: Rencana Amérika ngagunakeun serangan koordinasi tina tiga arah béda. Jenderal John Cadwalder bakal ngalancarkeun serangan pemanjangan ka pasukan Inggris di Bordentown, pikeun ngeblokkeun pasukan pambantu. Jenderal James Ewing bakal ngarangkeun 700 pasukan milisi lewat sungai di Trenton Ferry, ngarobah jembatan di Assunpink Creek sareng ngahindarkeun pasukan musuh ti lalakon. Pasukan utama 2.400 pasukan bakal leupas sungai 9 mil di luar Trenton, sareng kemudian ngabagi jadi dua grup, hiji di bawah Greene sareng hiji di bawah Sullivan, pikeun ngalancarkeun serangan di pagi hari.
ref: Rencana na Amerika ngandalkeun serangan anu diatur ti tilu arah nu béda. Jendral John Cadwalder bakal ngaluncurkeun serangan selingan keur garnisun na Inggris di Bordentown, keur ngahadang kabeh bantosan. Jendral James Ewing bakal mawa 700 milisi meuntas walungan dina Trenton Ferry, ngarebut jembatan di luhur Walungan Assunpink jeung nyegah kabeh pasukan musuh kabur. Pasukan penyerangan kahiji anu terdiri ti 2.400 lalaki arék meuntas wahangan, salapan mil di kalér Treton, terus dibagi jadi dua kelompok, hiji di handap Greene jeung hiji dihandap Sullivan, jang ngalakukeun serangan saméméh janari.

src: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."
mt: “Sanggeus dipilih ku Kongres tanggal 4 Juli, naskah tangan tina tanda tangan Presiden Kongres John Hancock sareng Sekretaris Charles Thomson dipindahkeun ka tukang cetak John Dunlap. Dina malam antara 150-200 naskah diproduksi, anu ayeuna katelah “Dunlap broadsides”. Bacaan publik pertama tina naskah éta diayakeun ku John Nixon di halaman Independence Hall tanggal 8 Juli. Satu dipindahkeun ka George Washington tanggal 6 Juli, anu dipakékeun ku tukangna di New York tanggal 9 Juli. Naskah éta tiba di London tanggal 10 Agustus. 25 naskah Dunlap broadsides anu masih diketahui masih aya di dunya nyaéta naskah anu paling lama tina naskah éta. Naskah tangan asli éta teu bisa diselamatkeun.”
ref: "Saatos diadopsi ku Kongrés dina kaping 4 Juli, rarancang tulisan leungeun anu ditandatanganan ku Présidén Kongrés John Hancock sareng Sekretaris Charles Thomson teras dikirim sababaraha blok ka toko percetakan John Dunlap. Di wengi éta, 150 dugi ka 200 lembar didamel , anu ayeuna kasohor janten ""Selebaran Dunlop"". Pembacaan dokumén di publik mimitina dilakukeun ku John Nixon dina Gedong Kemerdekaan Amérika kaping 8 Juli. 1 urang dikirim ka George Washington kaping 6 Juli anu dibaca ka pasukanana di New York kaping 9 Juli. Salinan nepi ka London di 10 Agustus. 25 Dunlap anu kawéntar masih kénéh jadi salinan dokumen pangkolotna anu tetep aya. Salinan tulisan leungeun aslina teu kasalametkeun."

src: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.
mt: Kolonis, ngalihat aktivitas éta, ogé ngajak pikeun pambantuan. Pasukan anu ngabangun deui posisi depanna ngandung 200 lalaki ti 1st sareng 3rd New Hampshire regiment, di bawah Kolonel John Stark sareng James Reed (sababaraha ngejadian jadi jéndral). Stark's men ngajabat di sekeliling pagar di ujung lor posisi kolonis. Saat pasang surutan ngabuka jambatan di sungai Mystic di ujung lor pangeun, méréh ngabangun pagar pendek sareng dinding batu ka lor ngaliwatan jambatan. Gridley atawa Stark ngabentuk tiang kira-kira 100 feet (30 m) di depan pagar sareng ngajalankeun yen teu aya anu ngabedah ngaliwatan tiang éta.
ref: Penjajah, ningali kagiatan iyeu, geus manggil bantosan oge. Pasukan anu nguatkeun posisi maju kaasup resimen New Hampshire ka-1 sarta ka-3 ti 200 jalmi, dihandap Kolonel John Stark sarta James Reed (duanana teras naek pangkat jenderal). Pasukan Stark geus nyandak posisi dina sapanjang pager di ujung kalér posisi Penjajah. Pas cai surut muka celah sapanjang Walungan Mystic nepi ka wetaneun semenanjung, aranjeunna geura-geura ngalegaan dinding pagér ku batu-batu leutik  nepi  ka bagian kalér anu tuntungna ujung cai di pantai leutik. Gridley atawa Stark masang tihang anu jangkungna kurang leuwih 100 suku (30 m) di hareupeun pager jeung marentahkeun supaya euweuh nu nembak nepi kabeh semah lewat.

src: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.
mt: China kuna mibanda cara unik pikeun ngalakukeun waktu-waktu éta; ti sababaraha tahapan China atawa sababaraha kulawarga anu ngabesarkeun téh dinasti. Ogé antara sababaraha dinasti éta, aya jaman nu instabil ti sababaraha provinsi nu dipisahkeun. Dinasti nu paling kanyataan ti jaman éta nyaéta jaman Tiga Kerajaan anu ngalakukeun pikeun 60 taun antara Han sareng Jin. Dina jaman éta, perang sengit ngalakukeun antara sababaraha bangsawan anu ngalakukeun pikeun tahta di tempat pangluhurna di istana di Xi’an.
ref: Tiongkok kuno gaduh cara unik keur ngabédakeun periode jaman, unggal tahapan Tiongkok atawa unggal kaluwarga nu gaduh kuasa nyaéta dinasti anu bénten. Tiap unggal dinasti ogé jaman henteu stabil nu dibagi ku sababaraha propinsi. Anu pangkasohor na di periode ieu nyaéta Jaman Tilu Karajaan anu lumangsung salamin 60 taun antara Dinasti Han sareng Dinasti Jin. Salami periode ieu perang sengit kajadian antara seeur bangsawan pikeun ngarebut tahta. Tilu Karajaan mangrupikeun salah sahiji éra anu paling numpahkeun getih dina sajarah Cina Kuno, rébuan jalma maot pikeun diuk di korsi paling luhur di istana ageung di Xi'an.

src: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.
mt: Kolonial lebah tentara ngalakukeun jeung ngadadia dina fase-fase béda. Dina fase nomad, lebah tentara ngalakukeun dina malam jeung ngadadia dina poé. Kolonial lebah tentara ngalakukeun fase nomad nalika panganan nu disadiakeunna teu cukup. Dina fase éta, kolonial lebah tentara ngadadia temporer anu diubah ti poé ka poé. Fase nomad éta ngalakukeun pikeun sakitar 17 poé.
ref: koloni tentara sireum babareungan sareng nyieun sarang dina béda-béda waktos. Dina fase nomad, sireum tentara ngabaris sapat sapeuting teras eureun jang berkemah pabeubeurang. Koloni mimitian tahap hirup nomaden pas persediaan dahareun ngurangan. Dina tahap ieu, koloni ngadamel sarang sementara nu digentos unggal dinten. Tiap-tiap pawai atanapi penjarahan ieu lumangsung kira-kira 17 dinten lamina.

src: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.
mt: Ritme-ritme nu sering ditempatkeun dina fisiologi sareng ngalakonan sering kali ngabutuhkeun siklus endogen sareng produksi ku jam biologis. Ritme-ritme périodik, anu teu ngahaja jadi respons ka cuitan périodik luar, geus dipapar pikeun sababaraha makéan, kaasup bakteri, jamur, tumbuhan, sareng hewan. Jam biologis nyaéta oscillator nu ngahasilkeun siklus bebas ngalirkeun sababaraha waktu dina keusangan cuitan luar.
ref: Seueur anu ngalakukeun panalungtikan irama dina fisiologi sareng tingkah laku sering pisan ngagumantung kana ayana siklus endogen sareng produksina ngaliwatan jam biologis. Ritme périodik, anu teu hungkul ngaréspon kana tawis periodik ti jabi, atos dicatet kanggo kalobaan mahluk hirup, kaasup baktéri, suweng, pepelakan, sareng sato. Jam biologis nyaeta osilator mandiri anu arek neruskeun periode siklus bebas bahkan upami heunteu aya tanda-tanda eksternal.

src: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.
mt: Populasi nyaéta koleksi organisme ti hiji spésies dina hiji wilayah geografis. Nalika sababaraha individu dina populasi sarua jeung ngeunaan hiji ciri fenotip, populasi éta katelah monomorfik. Nalika sababaraha individu ngalaman sababaraha variasi ti hiji ciri, populasi éta katelah polimorfik.
ref: Populasi mangrupikeun kumpulan organisme tertentu tina macem-macem spésiés di daérah géograpis tertentu. Lamun kabéh jelema dina hiji populasi sarua dumasarkeun kana phenotypic nu tangtu éta téh katelahna monomorphic. Nalika sato nunjukkeun sababaraha kalakuan tertentu disebut polimorfik.

src: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.
mt: Wisata alam ngalakukeun jalma nu minangka wisatawan anu minangka tujuan ngalakukeun wisata alam pikeun ngeunahkeun pemandangan, ngaliwatan tumbuhan sareng hirupan hewan. Conto aktivitas di tempat ngalakukeun ngahuntikeun, ngahijikeun, fotografi, ngepikirkeun, jeung ngalakukeun wisata di taman sareng ngalakukeun informasi ngeunaan ékosistem. Conto nyaéta ngalakukeun, ngahijikeun, jeung ngalakukeun organgatuangs di Borneo.
ref: Pariwisata berbasis alam narik minat masarakat pikeun nganjang ka daérah alam kalayan tujuanna pikeun menikmati pemandangan alam, kalebet pepelakan liar sareng sato. Conto kagiatan di tempat éta nyaeta moro, mancing, popotoan, nonton manuk, sareng ngunjungan taman teras diajar ngeunaan ékosistem. Misalna ngunjungan, nyandak gambar, sareng diajar ngeunaan orang utan di Kalimantan.

src: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.
mt: Tiap pagi, urang keluar ti desa-desa kecil di mobil pikeun ka tempat kerja jeung dilalapkeun ku urang séjén anu tempat kerjana nyaéta tempat anu urang geus keluar. Dina transport shuttle éta, sababaraha urang kénéh kaitan jeung, sareng ngahargaan, sistem transportasi nu bérésih di mobil pribadi. Ilmu sekarang ngajakkeun yen éta ekonomi karbon anu gedéna ngagulingkeun biosfer ti hiji nu stabil anu geus ngahargaan évolusi manusa pikeun dua juta taun.
ref: Unggal isuk, jalma-jalma ninggalkeun kota alit ku mobil pikeun nuju ka tempat kerjana  teras papasan jalma sanés anu tujuanana damel di tempat anu manehna kakara tinggalkeun. Dina angkutan anu dinamis ieu téh kabéh jelema kumaha waé bisa terhubung, sareng ngadukung, sistem angkutan anu didasari ku mobil pribadi. Élmu ayeuna nunjukkeun yén ékonomi karbon masif ieu parantos nyingkireun biosper ti 1 nagara anu stabil anu ngadukung évolusi manusa dina 2 juta taun ka pengker.

src: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.
mt: Atom bisa dianggap salakina ti bahan dasar nu ngabangunkeun segala bahan. src: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
mt: Komputer anu dipaké hirupna aya di jaman kiwari nyaéta di dasar manipulasi informasi anu dicodekeun dina bentuk angka biner. Angka biner téh bisa aya hiji di dua nilai, nyaéta 0 atawa 1, jeung angka-angka éta disebut digit biner - atawa bit, pikeun ngagunakeun jargon komputer.
ref: Sacara virtual sadaya komputer anu dipaké ayeuna didasarkeun dina manipulasi inpormasi anu disandikeun dina wangun angka binér. Angka binér ngan gaduh 1 tina 2 peunteun, nyaéta 0 atawa 1, sareng éta disebat digit binér - atawa bit, keur nganggo jargon komputer.

src: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."
mt: "Blogs ogé tiasa ngahasilkeun tulisan mahasiswa. Sementara mahasiswa biasana mimiti blogna jeung kakuatan gramatika sareng ejaan, hadirna audien biasana ngabalikkeun éta. Sabab mahasiswa biasana audien pangkritisna, tulisan blogna mimiti ngalakukeun pikeun ngajadikeun tulisan anu leuwih bagus pikeun ngahindarkeun kritik. Ogé blog ngajadikeun mahasiswa jadi leuwih pintar jeung leuwih bijaksana (Toto, 2004). Blog ngajadikeun mahasiswa jadi leuwih kolaboratif, jeung ngajadikeun mahasiswa jadi leuwih pintar jeung leuwih bijaksana (Toto, 2004). Blog ngajadikeun mahasiswa jadi leuwih kolaboratif, jeung ngajadike
ref: "Blog ogé tiasa ngabantosan ningkatkeun kamampuan nyeratna murid. Sedengkeun siswa sering ngamimitian pangalaman bloggingna ku tata basa leueur sareng éjahan, ayana pamirsa umumna ngarobih éta. Margi siswa nyaéta peserta nu mawi kritis, nu nulis blog mimiti bajoang ngembangkeun pangbisa nyeratna kanggo nyingkirkeun kritik. Ogé blogging ""mekarkeun mahasiswa janten langkung paham ngeunaan dunya di sakurilingna."" Pangabutuh pikeun ngawartosan minat pamiarsa janten inspirasi murid janten pinter sareng langkung menarik (Toto, 2004). Ngadamel blog nyaéta alat nu ngainspirasi kerja sama, sareng ngadorong murid pikeun nambah élmu anu diluar pelajaran sakola biasa. kagunaan blog anu alus teh nyaeta ""bisa ngagerakeun murid pikeun leuwih bisa nganalisa tur kritis; kusabab aktif narima materi ti internet, murid jadi bisa ngartikeun atau nangtukeun posisi maranehna dina harti jalma sejen' teu hilap nulis pamadegan maranehna dina masalah-masalah sejen (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
mt: Komunikasi asinkronus nyadiakeun waktu pikeun refleksi sareng reaksi ka beulah beulah. Ieu nyadiakeun mahasiswa kana hiji pangeusi pikeun kerja di hiji tempat sareng kontrol pangeusi pikeun informasi pangajaran. Ogé, aya hiji kawajiban waktu nu kurang sareng hiji kana hiji pangeusi pikeun jam kerja nu leuwih fleksibel. (Bremer, 1998) Gunana Internet sareng World Wide Web nyadiakeun akses ka informasi di sakabéh waktu. Mahasiswa ogé tiasa ngirimkeun pertanyaan ka pamongsa di sakabéh waktu sareng méré respons nu canggih, alatan teu nganunggu nganti réuni berhadapan wanci deui.
ref: Komunikasi heunteu asup mere waktu jang refleksi jeung bereaksi ka batur. Ieu midamel siswa tiasa ngadalikeun gawéan kalawan kagancangan maranéhanana sorangan sareng ngadalikeun kagancangan inpormasi instruksional. Iwal ti éta, aya batas waktos anu langkung saalit kalayanan kamungkinan waktos gawé anu fleksibel. Pamakéan Internét sareng Situs ngamungkinkeun para pangguna ngagaduhan aksés kana inpormasi sapanjang waktu. Murid ogé tiasa naroskeun ka guru iraha waé waktosna sareng ngarepkeun tanggepan anu lumayan gancang, tinimbang nungguan dugi ka rapat pasamoan.

src: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
mt: Kastil tradisional abad tengah lama-lamana ngiluak imajinasi, ngabentuk gambaran jousts, banquets sareng chivalry Arthur. Henteu ngalaman di antara reruntuhan sababaraha abad, éta henteu ngalaman pikeun ngabentuk suara sareng bau tina pertempuran lama, pikeun henteu ngalaman suara klop-klop kuda di jalan batu sareng bau takut tina lubang tahanan. Naha imajinasi éta bener? Naha kastil éta dibangun pikeun apa? Naha kastil éta dirancang sareng dibangun?
ref: Kastil abad pertengahan tradisional parantos lila ngainspirasi imajinasi, midamel urang ngabayangkeun olahraga kuda anggo tombak, jamuan pituangeun jeung sopan santun Arthurian. Sanajan nangtung di sakuriling bangunan ruksak anu geus rébuan taun, geuwat ngingetkeun sora sareng ka ambu aroma pertempuran anu parantos lami. Sareng tiasa ngadangukeun sora suku kuda di jalan anu taringgul jeung tiasa ngaungkeun kasieun anu timbul tina liang jero taneuh. Tapi emang na imajinasi urang dumasar kana kanyataan? Naha istana diwangun mimitina? Kumaha cara wangunan dirarancang jeung diwangun?

src: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.
mt: Typical pikeun jaman éta, Kirby Muxloe Castle leuwih loba tina rumah pangayuban ti kasar. Pintu kaca gedéna sareng dindingna anu tipisna tiasa teu bisa nahan serangan nu teras pikeun lama. Dina 1480-an, nalika konstruksi éta dimimiti ku Lord Hastings, nagara éta teu bébas ti perang sareng pangayuban teu perlu pikeun ngahadang bandar-bandar roving marauders.
ref: Khusus pikeun periode ieu, Kastil Kirby Muxloe langkung mangrupikeun bumi anu dikubeng ku bénténg tina bénténg anu leres. Jandela kaca anu ageung jeung témbok ipis moal tahan lila kana panarajang paos nu tos ditentukeun pikeun waktu nu lami. Dina taun 1480-an, nalika konstruksi dimimiti ku Tuan Hastings, nagara ieu rukun répéh sareng pertahanan ngan diperyogikeun ngalawan gorombolan leutik begal anu sok kukuriling.

src: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.
mt: Kadieunkeun ti 400 méter ka 800 méter, kecepatan jadi kurang penting sareng ketahanan jadi hal anu ngahaja. Tentu saja, seorang atlet 800 méter, seseorang anu bisa ngalampahkeun dua menit, mesti dipunyakkeun ku kecepatan anu cukup, tapi ketahanan mesti dikultivasi dina segala hal. src: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.
mt: Praktik nutrisi anu tepat sajén ngan tiasa ngahasilkeun performa élite, tapi éta tiasa ngarobah umumna kesehatan atlit muda. Ngarawangkeun keseimbangan énergi anu sehat, praktikkeun kebiasaan hidrasi anu efektif, sareng ngerti aspek-aspek variasi praktik suplénan tiasa ngahasilkeun atlit ngajadikeun performa anjeunna sareng nambah kasenangan anjeunna dina olahraga.
ref: Keur ngahasilkeun kamampuan nu elit teu tiasa ngan ti kabiasaan nutrisi nu leres hungkul, tapi eta tiasa ngaruh pisan pikeun kasehatan atlit ngora sacara umum. Ngajaga kasaimbangan énergi nu séhat, ngalaksanakeun kabiasaan hidrasi nu mujarab, jeung ngarti kana macem-macem aspék kabiasaan suplemén tiasa ngabantu atlit keur ningkatkeun kamampuan aranjeuna jeung ningkatkeun kanikmatan dina olahraga na.

src: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.
mt: Jalan tengah lari téh hiji olahraga nu hargana murah; tapi, aya sababaraha kesalahpahaman ngeunaan hiji-hijina barang-barang anu kudu dipaké pikeun ngahasilkeun hasil. src: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.
mt: MRI nyaéta ngabangun tina fenomena fisika nu disebut nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), anu ditemukan dina 1930-an ku Felix Bloch (ngalakonan di Universitas Stanford) sareng Edward Purcell (tina Universitas Harvard). Dina resonansi éta, medan magnet sareng gelombang radio nyababkeun atom nyababkeun sinyal radio leutik. Dina taun 1970, Raymond Damadian, dokter sareng ilmuan peneliti, ngadegkeun basis pikeun ngagunakeun magnetic resonance imaging minangka alat pikeun diagnosis kesehatan. Paten éta dipaténkeun dina taun 1974, anu nyaéta paten dunya mung paten nu dipaténkeun dina bidang MRI. Dina 1977, Dr. Damadian ngabangun scanner MRI “whole-body” munggaran, anu disebut ku “Indomitable”.
ref: "MRI téh dumasar kana fénoména fisik nu disebat résonansi magnétik nuklir (RMN), ieu kapendak kirang langkung di taun 1930 ku Felix Bloch (damel di Universitas Stanford) sareng Edward Purcell (ti Universitas Harvard). Dina résonansi ieu, médan magnet jeung gelombang radio nyebabkeun atom ngaluarkeun sinyal radio leutik. Dina taun 1970, Raymond Damadian, dokter médis sareng panaliti, mendakan dasar pikeun nganggo penilaian résonansi magnétik minangka pakakas pamariksa médis. 4 taun saatos éta tiasa kenging ijin patén, ieu mangrupa patén nu kahiji dina bidang MRI. Taun 1977, Dr. Damadian ngabereskeun pangwangunan pendeteksi MRI ""saluruh awak"" anu anjeunna pasihan nami ""Indomitable""."

src: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.
mt: Walaupun AI ngadatana konotasi fiksi ilmiah, AI ngagabungkeun ngaran penting ti ilmu komputer, anu ngahasilkeun tindakan, belajar sareng adaptasi nu pintar di hiji mesin. Riset di AI ngahasilkeun mesin anu ngabutuhkeun tindakan pintar. Conto di antarana nganjal, perencanaan sareng jadwal, kacepetan ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngab
ref: Sanajan AI gaduh konotasi fiksi ilmiah anu kuat, AI ngabentuk cabang ilmiah komputer anu penting, urusana sareng tingkah laku, cara diajar sareng adaptasi calakan dina mesin. Penelitian dina AI ngalibatkeun nyieun mesin keur ngaotomatiskeun padamelan nu ngabutuhkeun kacerdasan jalmi. contona kaasup kontrol, perencanaan sarta penjadwalan, pangabisa kanggo ngawalon diagnosa sarta patarosan langganan, sarta ngawanohan seratan panangan, soanten sarta beungeut. Perkara anu sapertos kitu téh tos janten kaélmuan anu kapisah, anu khusus pikeun nyadiakeun solusi pikeun masalah anu nyata. Sistem AI téh ayeuna sering dianggo dina ékonomi, ubar, rékayasa sareng militér, sabab parantos diwangun kana sababaraha aplikasi komputer bumi sareng parangkat lunak video game.

src: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.
mt: Walaupun AI ngadatana konotasi fiksi ilmiah, AI ngagabungkeun ngaran penting ti ilmu komputer, anu ngahasilkeun tindakan, belajar sareng adaptasi nu pintar di hiji mesin. Riset di AI ngahasilkeun mesin anu ngabutuhkeun tindakan pintar. Conto di antarana nganjal, perencanaan sareng jadwal, kacepetan ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngabubutuhkeun tindakan pintar, anu bisa ngab
ref: Sanajan AI gaduh konotasi fiksi ilmiah anu kuat, AI ngabentuk cabang ilmiah komputer anu penting, urusana sareng tingkah laku, cara diajar sareng adaptasi calakan dina mesin. Penelitian dina AI ngalibatkeun nyieun mesin keur ngaotomatiskeun padamelan nu ngabutuhkeun kacerdasan jalmi. contona kaasup kontrol, perencanaan sarta penjadwalan, pangabisa kanggo ngawalon diagnosa sarta patarosan langganan, sarta ngawanohan seratan panangan, soanten sarta beungeut. Perkara anu sapertos kitu téh tos janten kaélmuan anu kapisah, anu khusus pikeun nyadiakeun solusi pikeun masalah anu nyata. Sistem AI téh ayeuna sering dianggo dina ékonomi, ubar, rékayasa sareng militér, sabab parantos diwangun kana sababaraha aplikasi komputer bumi sareng parangkat lunak video game.

src: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

Jalmi anu pamikirana sapertos kieu gaduh pamikiran logis, anu mampu ngemutkeun pola, mereskeun masalah sareng ngerjakeun tés-tés ilmiah.

src: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
mt: Kagunaan vidéo rekaman ngabalukarkeun penemuan penting dina interpretasi mikro-eksprési, gerakan wajah anu ngadegkeun saeutik. Tapi, di klaim yén seseorang tiasa ngadeteksi seseorang anu nyebat ku nginterpretasi mikro-eksprési anu teuas. Oliver Sacks, dina makéanana The President's Speech, ngindikasikeun yén jalma anu teu bisa ngerti basa ku lantaran gangguan otak nyaéta tiasa ngabéakkeun seseorang anu teuas ku nginterpretasi sasakitan anu teuas. Éta ogé ngajakkeun yén kawajiban anu teuas ku nginterpretasi tina tindakan jalma bisa dipaké ku hewan anu teuas saperti anjing domestik.
ref: Kagunaan rékaman pideo parantos ngahasilkeun penemuan-penemuan penting dina interpretasi ekspresi alit, gerakan-gerakan raray anu ngan katingali sababaraha milidetik. Sacara khusus, disebutkeun anjeuntiasa terang éta jalmi ngawadul atawa henteu ku nagsirkeun ekspresi saalit rarayna nu leres. Oliver Sacks, dina suratna nyaeta Pidato Presiden, ngagambarkeun yen kumaha jalma anu teu bisa ngarti kana pidato kusabab otakna kaganggu bisa nganilai kana katulusan jalma anu pidato. Anjeunna malah nyarankeun yén kamampuan sapertos kitu dina napsirkeun kalakuan manusa tiasa dipiboga ku sato sapertos anjing piaraan.

src: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.
mt: Internet ngahubungan antara élmu komunikasi massa sareng komunikasi antar pribadi. Karakteristik khas ti Internet nyieunna ngahasilkeun dimensi-dimensi anyar dina pendekatan gratifikasi. Misalna, “pembelajaran” sareng “sosialisasi” disarankan minangka motivasi penting pikeun ngagunakeun internet (James et al., 1995). “Keterlibatan pribadi” sareng “hubungan berkelanjutan” ogé diidentifikasi minangka aspek-aspek motivasi anyar ku Eighmey sareng McCord (1998) nalika ngalakonan panyelidikan reaksi audiens ka situs web.
ref: "Internét ngagabungkeun duanana unsur komunikasi massa sareng antarpribadi. Ciri nu béda ti Internét ngajuru ka diménsi tambahan dina hal pamakéan sareng cara gratipikasi. Contona, ""diajar"" jeung ""sosialisasi"" disarankeun janten motivasi penting keur nganggo internét (James jeung nu sanés., 1995). Kalibetan jalmi"" sareng ""hubungan nu teras"" téh dianggep hal anu nyieun sumanget ku Eighmey sareng McCord (1998) basa éta aranjeunna mariksa kumaha urang réaksi kana website."

src: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
mt: Gothic style ngahasilkeun hasilna di antara période 10-11 abad sareng 14 abad. Di awalna busana dipengaruh ku budaya Bizantium di timur. Aya sababaraha sabab, kaasup komunikasi anu lila, gaya di barat bisa kalah jeung gaya di timur ku sababaraha taun. kaasup di akhir abad tengah, Eropa barat mulai ngahasilkeun gaya anu béda. sababaraha sabab paling jelas ti hasilna ti perang salib, urang ngagunakeun tombol pikeun ngabuka busana.
ref: Gaya gothic puncak na dina antawis abad ka 10 - 11 sareng abad ka-14. Mimitina pakean kuat dipangaruhan ku budaya Byzantine di wétan. Nanging, kusabab ku saluran komunikasi na teh laun, gaya anu aya di kulon tiasa katinggaleun 25 dugi 30 taun. nyanghareupan panungtung Abad Panengahan, Eropa Kulon mimiti ngembangkeun gaya anjeunna nyalira. Hiji perkembangan anu paling ageung nyaéta jalmi-jalmi mulai nganggé kancing supados enggal di acuk na.

src: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.
mt: Kita bisa mulai hidup leuwih ramah jeung lingkungan, kita bisa ngabagi pikeun gerakan lingkungan, jeung kita bisa jadi aktivis pikeun ngurangi panyakit di masa depan dina derajat anu leuwih luhur. src: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.
mt: Balans kekuatan téh hiji sistem di mana nagara-nagara Eropa ngalakukeun pikeun ngawangun kakuasaan nasional ti kabéh nagara-nagara Eropa. Konsepna nyaéta kabéh nagara-nagara Eropa kudu ngalakukeun pikeun ngahindarkeun hiji nagara tina jadi kuat, sareng jadi ieu, pamaréntahan nasional sering kali ngalakukeun perubahan aliansi pikeun ngawangun balans. Perang Spanyol War Succession téh ngalambangkeun perang munggaran anu isu utamana nyaéta balans kekuatan. Ieu ngalambangkeun perubahan penting, sabab nagara-nagara Eropa teu bakal ngalakukeun alasan pikeun jadi perang agama.
ref: Kasaimbangan kawasa nyaéta sistem di mana nagara-nagara Éropa ngusahakeun mertahankeun kadaulatan nasional sakumna nagara di Éropa. Konsépna nyaéta yén sadaya nagara Éropa kudu usaha nyegah hiji nagara janten kuat, margi kitu pamarentah nasional sering ngarobah aliansi aranjeunna pikeun ngajaga kasaimbangan. Perang Suksesi Spanyol nandakeun perang mimiti anu masalah utamana nyaeta tentang kekuasaan nu saimbang. Ieu nandakeun parobahan anu penting, sabab kakawasaan Éropa henteu deui gaduh dalih keur perang agama. Kusabab éta, Perang Tilu puluh Taun bakal janten perang terakhir anu dilabélan perang agama.

src: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.
mt: Salila période sejarah Eropa, Gereja Katolik, anu geus jadi kaya rata sareng kuat, datang di bawah panyelidikan. Salila sababaraha ratusan taun, agama Kristen geus ngabondkeun nagara-nagara Eropa sababaraha, alatan béda-beda basa sareng adat. I Kakuatan anu ngawujudkeun éta ngarosotkeun sababaraha ti raja ka umum. Salah sahiji ti dasar agama Kristen nyaéta yen harta dipaké pikeun ngurangi panyakit sareng kemiskinan sareng yen dana monéter gereja éta khusus pikeun alasan éta. Kakuatan pusat ti gereja éta geus aya di Roma salila sababaraha ratusan taun sareng ieu konsentrasi kuatan sareng dana éta ngalakukeun sababaraha jalma pikeun ngabahas nyaéta ieu dasar nyaéta dipaké.
ref: Salami periode sajarah Eropa ieu, Gereja Katolik, anu parantos beunghar sareng kuat, diawaskeun sacara raket. Salami langkung ti sarébu taun Kristen parantos ngabeungkeut nagara-nagara Éropa sanajan basa sareng adat na baréda. Kakiatan na anu menyeluruh ngawengku saban jalmi mimiti ti raja dugi rahayat jelata. Hiji prinsip Kristen anu utama nyaéta harta téh kedah dianggo pikeun ngaringankeun penderitaan sareng kamiskinan teras kauangan gereja téh aya kusabab alesan éta. Otoritas pusat garéja dipuseurkeun di Roma langkung ti sarébu taun. Konsentrasi kakuatan sareng artos ieu nyababkeun seueur patarosan ngeunaan ieu ajaran.

src: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.
mt: Raja Louis XVI, Ratu Marie Antoinette, dua anakna (11 taun Marie Therese sareng 4 taun Louis-Charles) sareng adi raja Madam Elizabeth, dina 6 Oktober 1789 dipaksa balik ka Paris tina Versailles ku massa pasar. Dina kandara, éta keluarga dipindahkeun ka Paris ku massa anu ngagoréng sareng ngancem raja sareng ratu. Massa éta ngagoréng raja sareng ratu pikeun jendela kandara éta dibuka lebar. Dina hiji waktu, salah saurang ti massa éta ngagoréngkeun kepalan ti garda raja anu dipaténi di Versailles ka ratu anu teuas.
ref: Raja Louis XVI anu sieun, Ratu Marie Antoinette, dua putra alit anjeunna (umur 11 taun Marie Therese sareng 4 taun Louis-Charles) sareng adi raja, Madam Elizabeth, dina 6 Oktober 1789 dipaksa uih ka Paris ti Versailles ku masa pasar wanoja. Dina kareta,maranehanana ngalakukeun lalampahan balik ka Paris dikurilingan ku segerombolan jalmi ceuceuleuweungan sarta ngajorowokeun anceman ka Raja sarta Ratu. Kalompok massal maksakeun raja sareng ratu ngabuka jandéla gerbong na. Dina hiji waktu, salah sahiji anggota ti gorombolan nempokeun hulu penjaga karajaan anu dipaehan di Versailles dihareupeun ratu anu sieun.

src: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
mt: Kaputusan ngadepan perang, Britania ngalakukeun blokade laut jeung Jérman. Strategi éta tiasa ngahasilkeun, ngabatasi pasokan militer sareng sipil nu vital, sanajan blokade éta ngalanggar hukum internasional umum anu diatur ku sababaraha perjanjian internasional dina dua abad ka tukang. Britania ngaminyakkeun laut internasional pikeun ngahindarkeun kapal ti masuk ka bagian-bagian laut, nu ngabalukarkeun kacurangan pikeun kapal nu netral. Sabab teu aya respons terhadap taktik éta, Jérman ngarasa sababaraha respons pikeun perang laut bébas.
ref: Gewat saeunggeus perang peupeus, Inggris ngabejaan blokade laut Jerman. Strategina kabukten epektip, ngereunkeun pasadiaan militer sareng sipil nu penting, sanaos blokade eta ngalanggar hukum Internasional anu di tampi sacara umum dikodifikasi ku sababaraha perjanjian Internasional salami 2 abad kapengker. Britania nerapkeun ranjau di lautna pikeun ngahalangan kapal sejen asup ka wilayahna, anu bisa nyebabkeun kaancuran kitu deui pikeun kapal anu netral. Kusabab respon kabatas ku taktik ieu, Jerman ngarepkeun respon anu sami pikeun perang kapal selam anu teu dibatesan.

src: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.
mt: Di Amerika Serikat, aya sakitar 400.000 kasus Multiple Sclerosis (MS) anu diketahuan, anu nyieunna jadi panyakit neurologis anu pangdominan di antara dewasa muda sareng dewasa tengah. MS nyaéta panyakit anu ngarubuhkeun sistem saraf pusat, anu teras dibentuk ku otak, sumanget sareng saraf optik. Penelitian ngabogaan yén wanita dua kali kawengku pikeun ngalaman MS tibatan pria.
ref: Di sakumna Amérika Serikat, aya kira-kira 400.000 kasus Multiple Sclerosis (MS), ngajadikeunna salaku panyawat sarap anu panglobana nyerang jalmi déwasa sareng nu rada kolot. MS nyaéta panyakit anu nyerang sistem sarap pusat, anu termasuk polo, sumsum tulang pengker, sarta sarap optik. Panilitian mendakan yén awéwé dua kali kamungkinan gaduh MS tibatan lalaki.

src: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.
mt: Studi éta nyadiakeun yén depresi, takut sareng katasfisasi ngamédiasi hubungan antara panyakit sareng kacatatan dina penderita panyakit payudara. Hiji-saja efek katasfisasi, teu depresi sareng takut téh kondisional ti sesi PA rutin mingguan struktur. Anu ngilu dina PA rutin ngaharapkeun bantuan dina ngabédakeun perbedaan panyakit payudara sareng kacatatan nu disababkeun ku gerakan fisik normal.
ref: Penelitian manggihan nyaeta depresi, sieun jeung bencana ngahubungkeun nyeri jeung kacacatan anu ngabogaan nyeri tonggong bagian handap. Ngan ukur akibat ti bencana, sanés déprési sareng kasieun anu bersarat ti sési PA nu terstruktur anu rutin mingguan. Aranjeunna anu ngiringan dina aktivitas biasa kedah narima dukungan langkung dina pikiran goréng terhadao nyeri ngabédakeun antara nyeri parah sareng rarasaan teu nyaman ti gerakan awak anu biasa waé.

src: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.
mt: Olahraga modern tina tumbak téh dipelak di sababaraha tingkatan, ti mahasiswa anu ngalaman di universitas ka kompetisi profesional sareng Olimpiade. Olahraga éta dipelak dina format duel, hiji tumbak dueling tumbak séjénna.
ref: Anggar modern dimaénkeun di sagala rupa tingkat, ti mahasiswa anu diajar di paguron luhur nepi ka kompetisi profésional sareng Olimpiade. Olahraga ieu biasana tanding, hiji pamaén anggar ngalawan anu sanés.

src: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
mt: Kasus panyakit internal mungkin teu bisa diidentifikasi dina waktu nu lila. Gejala, saperti muntah, teu bisa langsung diidentifikasi. Indikasi paling bagus panyakit internal mungkin nyaéta keberadaan wadah bébas obat-obatan atawa bahan kimia rumah tangga anu toksik. Cek label pikeun instruksi pertolongan pertama spésifik pikeun racun éta.
ref: Karacunan internal teu tiasa langsung katingali. Gejala, sapertos utah cekap umum ku kituna diagnosis langsung henteu tiasa didamel. Indikasi pangsaéna peracunan lebet nyaéta ayana wadah obat kabuka anu dieusian ku ubar atanapi bahan kimia rumah tangga anu beracun. Pariksa labél keur paréntah pitulung mimiti pikeun racun khusus éta.

src: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.
mt: Untuk mengecek korban, kalian perlu terlebih dahulu memeriksa lokasi untuk memastikan keamanan. Kalian perlu memperhatikan posisi korban saat mendekatinya dan segala tanda merah otomatis. Jika kalian cedera saat membantu, kalian mungkin hanya akan membuat hal-hal menjadi lebih buruk.
ref: Pikeun mariksa korban, anjeun mimiti kedah naliti tempatna pikeun mastikeun kasalametan anjeun. Anjeun kudu perhatoskeun posisi korban nalika ngadekeutan korban jeung perhatoskeun oge bendera bereum otomatis. Upami anjeun nyeuri kusabab ngabantosan, anjeun ngan saukur ngajantenkeun masalah langkung parah.

src: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.
mt: Salah sahiji dampak sosial sareng politik nyaéta penggunaan sistem métrik, perpindahan ti absolutisme ka republikanisme, nasionalisme sareng yakinan yén nagri éta milik rakyat, teu milik hiji pamingpin. Ogé sanggeus Révolusi pekerjaan kagolongkeun ka sakabéh pria pangajabangsaan sareng pangjajabangsaan anu tiasa ngajabat, nu ngahasilkeun nu pangambisi sareng pangjajabangsaan tiasa ngahasilkeun. src: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
mt: Tiap jalma tiasa ngalakukeun sosial sareng ngagunakeun sistem transportasi. Hampir tiap jalma ngomong ngeunaan sistem transportasi. Dina nagara nu geus maju, kudu anu ngomong ngeunaan kualitas air atawa jembatan anu tigil, alatan. Ngeunaan sistem transportasi, sababana sistem transportasi tiasa ngalaman keluhan anu luhur, sababana sistem transportasi tiasa gagal ti saprak dina poé? Apakah para insinyur transportasi tiasa ngalaman keluhan anu luhur? Atau aya hal nu leuwih mendasar anu ngalaman?
ref: Kabeh ge milu ulu biung ka masarakat jeung nganggo alat transportasi umum. Hampir sakabehna jalma ngeluhkeun sistem transportasi Di nagara maju anjeun jarang nguping kahumandeuar anu sami ngeunaan kualitas cai atawa jembatan anu runtuh. Naha sistem transportasi téh naékkeun keluhan sapertos kitu, naha gagal unggal dinten? Naha insinyur transportasi ngan henteu kompetén? Atanapi aya anu langkung dasar kajadian?

src: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.
mt: Traffic Flow nyaéta studi ngeunaan gerakan individu pambalap sareng mobil antara dua titik jeung interaksi anu dijieun ku sababaraha. Sayugna, ngalakukeun studi traffic flow teu bisa diprediksi ku persentase seratus persen. Sayugna, pambalap biasana ngalakukeun gerakan anu konsisten; jadi, aliran traffic biasana konsisten jeung bisa diwakilan ku matematik. Pikeun ngagambarkeun traffic flow leuwih baik, hubungan dijieun antara tiga karakteristik utama: (1) aliran, (2) kepadatan, jeung (3) kecepatan. Hubungan-hubungan éta tiasa ngabantu dina perencanaan, perancangan, jeung operasi fasilitas jalan.
ref: Aliran Lalu lintas mangrupikeun ulikan ngeunaan gerakan panggerak sareng kandaraan individu antara 2 poin sareng interaksi hubungan 1 jeung nu lainna. Hanjakalna, diajar alur lalulintas téh sesah kusabab kalakuan jurumudina teu tiasa diprediksi kapastianna 1 persén. Untungna, supir condong kana perilaku anu cukup konsisten; samentawis kitu, arus lalu lintas condong gaduh konsistensi anu wajar sareng kasarna tiasa digambarkeun secara matematis. Pikeun langkung jéntré ngagambarkeun arus lalar, hubungan parantos didamel dina tilu ciri utami: (1) arus, (2) kapadetan, sareng (3) kecepatan. Hubungan ieu ngabantu dina perencanaan, rarancangan, jeung operasina fasilitas jalan raya.

src: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.
mt: Éksperimén Hershey sareng Chase téh hiji tina saran pangdeungkeut anu DNA nyaéta bahan génétik. Hershey sareng Chase ngagunakeun phage, atawa virus, pikeun ngimplikasikeun DNA éta ka bakteri. Mereka ngalakukeun dua éksperimén ngarangkeun DNA dina phage jeung radioaktif fosforus atawa protein dina phage jeung radioaktif sulfur.
ref: Eksperimen The Hersheydan Chase salah sahiji panalungtikan anu ngungkapkeun margi DNA nyaeta materi genetik. Hershey sareng Chase nganggo fag, atanapi virus, pikeun nyisipkeun DNA aranjeunna ka baktéri. Aranjeunna nyobian dua percobaan anu nandaan DNA dina phage nu aya fosfor radioaktif atawa protéin tina phage nu aya walirang radioaktif.

src: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.
mt: Mutasi bisa ngabalukarkeun sababaraha variasi efek, terasana ti tipe mutasi, pentingna bagian materi genetik anu dipaké sareng apakah sel anu dipaké nyaéta sel germ-line. Sajenre mutasi di sel germ-line tiasa disampaan ka anak-anak, sementara mutasi séjénna bisa nyababkeun sel mati atawa kanker.
ref: Mutasi tiasa gaduh sababaraha epek beda gumantung kana jenis mutasina, pentingna bahan genetik anu dipangaruhan sareng naha sel anu dipangaruhan ku sel nu lainna. Ngan mutasi dina sél garis kuman anu tiasa diturunkeun ka murangkalih, sedengkeun mutasi di tempat sanésna tiasa nyababkeun sélna maot atanapi kanker.

src: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
mt: Kambing téh dipikanyahar sababaraha 10.000 taun ka tukang di gunung Zagros di Iran. Budaya jeung suku-suku kuna mimiti ngahadéan kambing pikeun akses leuwih gampang ka bahan baku susu, bulu, daging, sareng kulit. Kambing domestik dipikanyahar di kawanan anu ngalaman di bukit-bukit atawa wewengkon séjén anu dipelihara ku anak-anak atawa remaja anu sering disebut goatherds anu sarua jeung yang lebih dikenal shepherd. Metode-metode ngahadéan éta masih dipaké hirupna.
ref: Embé kos namah partama kali dipiara téh kirang langkung 10.000 taun kapungkur di Gunung Zagros di Iran. kabeh budaya jeung suku baheula nu ngamimitian gampangna milarian susu, buuk, daging, sareng kulit Embé jinak umumna dipiara dina gerombolan anu dilepas di daérah perbukitan atawa daerah nganggon nu séjénna, biasa dianggon ku budak leutik atanapi nu budak rada gedé, mirip jeung tukang nganggon nu batur apal. Cara nganggon siga kieu masih kénéh dipaké nepi ayeuna.

src: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.
mt: Golf nyaéta hiji permainan anu para pemainna ngagunakeun klub pikeun ngabenturkeun bola ka lubang. Dina hiji ronde biasa, 18 lubang dipelak, jeung para pemainna biasa ngamimitan ti lubang pertama di lapangan jeung ngabenturkeun di lubang ka-18. Pemain anu ngalakukeun dina jumlah gerakan paling saeutik, atawa pukulan klub, pikeun ngabenturkeun lapangan ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun ngabenturkeun
ref: Golf nyaéta permaénan anu dimana pemaénna nganggo stik keur nepak bola ka lobang. Dalapan belas liang diheureuykeun salila puteran reguler, jeung pamaen biasana dimimitian kana liang kahiji jeung akhirna di liang ka dalapan belas. Pamaen anu neunggeulan bola golf nu paling sakedik, atawa ayunan stikna ti klub, kanggo ngabereskeun permainan, manehna nu meunang. Kaulinan ieu dipaénkeun dina jukut, sareng jukut di sakitar liang dipotong langkung pondok sareng disebat héjo.

src: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
mt: Ilmu ngalakukeun tujuan utamana nyaéta ngabogaan kajian ngeunaan cara dunya bekerja ku cara ngagunakeun metode ilmiah. Metode éta téh ngan ngajadikeun pangabogaan ilmiah. Tapi, ngalakukeun eksperimen, eksperimen téh nyaéta tes anu dipaké pikeun ngabagi-bagi salah sahiji atawa leuwih ti hipotesis munggaran, nanya, sareng ngalakukeun observasi ogé ngabogaan pangabogaan ilmiah.
ref: Tujuan utama elmu teh kanggo manggihan kumaha jalanna dunya iyeu lewat cara nu ilmiah. sabenerna cara iyeu jadi pitunjuk kanggo lolobana panalungtikan ilmiah. Éta henteu nyalira, ékspérimén, sareng ékspérimén mangrupikeun tés anu digunakeun pikeun ngaleungitkeun hiji atanapi langkung kamungkinan hipotésis, naroskeun patarosan, sareng ngajantenkeun pengamatan sarta ogé ngabimbing panilitian ilmiah.

src: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: Angin tornado ngancam wewengkon leutik dibandingkeun jeung angin badai lian, tapi bisa ngababatkeun segala hal anu ngalir di jalan. Angin tornado ngababatkeun pohon, ngababatkeun papan ti bangunan, sareng ngababatkeun mobil. Angin tornado anu paling kacida ngancam ngalakukeun leuwih ti saprak tiga jam. Angin tornado éta ngalir ngaliwatan 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Angin topan ngancurkeun daerah nu langkung alit tibatan badai anu lain, tapi tiasa ngancurkeun kabéh anu aya dina jalurna. Tornado nyabut tangkal, nyoekkeun papan ti gedong, sarta ngapungkeun mobil ka langit. 2 persen tornado nu mawi kejem lumangsung langkung ti 3 jam. Badai monster iyeu boga angin nu kecepatanna nepikeun ka 480 km/jam (133 m/detik; 300 mph).

src: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: Angin tornado ngancam wewengkon leutik dibandingkeun jeung angin badai lian, tapi bisa ngababatkeun segala hal anu ngalir di jalan. Angin tornado ngababatkeun pohon, ngababatkeun papan ti bangunan, sareng ngababatkeun mobil. Angin tornado anu paling kacida ngancam ngalakukeun leuwih ti saprak tiga jam. Angin tornado éta ngalir ngaliwatan 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Angin topan ngancurkeun daerah nu langkung alit tibatan badai anu lain, tapi tiasa ngancurkeun kabéh anu aya dina jalurna. Tornado nyabut tangkal, nyoekkeun papan ti gedong, sarta ngapungkeun mobil ka langit. 2 persen tornado nu mawi kejem lumangsung langkung ti 3 jam. Badai monster iyeu boga angin nu kecepatanna nepikeun ka 480 km/jam (133 m/detik; 300 mph).

src: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.
mt: Manusia geus nyieun sareng ngagunakeun lensa pikeun pambesaran pikeun ribuan jeung ribuan taun. Anu mungkina teleskop anu asli geus dijieun di Eropa dina abad ka-16. Teleskop éta ngagunakeun kombinasi dua lensa pikeun nyieun objék jauh anu geus deukeut sareng leuwih gedé.
ref: Jelema tos ngajieun jeung nganggo lensa keur ngagedekeun mang rebu-rebu taun. Tapi, téléskop anu bener mimiti dijieun di Éropa di ahir abad ka-16. Téléskop-téléskop ieu nganggo gabungan ti dua lensa supados objék anu tebih tiasa katingal caket sareng ageung.

src: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
mt: Muhammad ngan ngan ngan kaguman ka hal-hal anu leuwih jauh ti kahirupan biasa. Anjeunna sering-sering ngalakonan ka goa nu jadi kawentar “Hira‘” di gunung “Noor” (cahaya) pikeun ngalakonan ka pikiran. goa éta, anu ngalawan waktu, ngabogaan gambaran anu jelas tina kaguman spiritual Muhammad. Ngora di puncak salah sahiji gunung kalér ti Mekah, goa éta leuwih jauh ti dunya. Faktana, teu gampang pikeun nyieunna. Saterusna, goa éta teu bisa ditempo ka mana-mana. Hal-hal anu jelas tina goa éta nyaéta langit anu jelas sareng jelas sareng gunung-gunung nu ngabogaan. Hal-hal anu leuwih jauh ti dunya teu bisa ditempo atawa didengar tina goa éta.
ref: "Muhammad téh resep pisan kana sagala rupi hal anu teu biasa dina kahirupan duniawi. Anjeunna sering dongkap ka hiji gua nu ayeuna disebat ""Hira"" dina gunung ""Noor"" (cahya) kanggo méditasi. Guha éta sorangan, anu salamet ti jaman ka jaman, masihan gambaran ngeunaan arah spiritual Muhammad. Lokasina dina salah 1 puncak gunung belah kaler Mekkah, guha ieu terasing pisan tina dunya luar. Nyatana, eta henteu gampang mendakanana pisan sanaos aya 1 nu terang perkawis eta. Sakali jero guha, eta teh terasing total. Teu aya anu tiasa ditingali salain langit anu jelas sareng éndah di luhur sareng seueur gunung di sakurilingna. Saeutik pisan dunya ieu tiasa ditingali atanapi didangu ti jero guha."

src: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
mt: Wagonways di Inggris dibangun ti abad ka-16. Walaupun wagonways ngan ngandung plang-panjangan kayu, ieu nyadiakeun kecepatan jeung muatan nu leuwih luhur ti jalan-jalan nu leuwih kasar ti harita. Cross-ties dipaké pikeun nahan track. Dina waktu, ieu dipikanyaho yén track leuwih efisien jikalau aya stip iron di bagian atas. Ieu jadi praktik umum, tapi iron ngabalukarkeun leuwesna kayu di roda wagon. Akhirna, roda kayu diganti jeung roda iron. Dina 1767, rail iron purna dipaké.
ref: Wagonway diwangun di Inggris dina mimiti abad ka-16. Sanajan gerobak mung didamel ti papan kayu anu sajajar hungkul, tapi bakal tiasa ngadamel kuda pikeun langkung gancang sareng narik beban anu langkung beurat tibatan di jalan butut. Crossties diwanohkeun cekap mimiti kanggo nahan trek di tempatna. Nanging, laun laun disadari yen lintasan bakal langkung efisien lamun aya beusi di luhurna. Ieu téh atos janten praktik anu biasa, tapina beusi téh nyieun langkung seueur karuksakan kana roda kayu gerobakna. Ahirna, kikiping kai atos digantikeun ku kikiping beusi. Dina 1767, rel kahiji anu sapinuhna beusi diwanohkeun.
