src: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
mt: Romantisme ngandung élémén nu leuwih luhur ti determinisme budaya, anu dihimpun tina tulisan-tulisan ti Goethe, Fichte, sareng Schlegel. Dina konteks Romantisme, géografi ngarangkeun individu, sareng dina waktu, adat sareng budaya nu patali jeung géografi éta muncul, sareng ieu, anu ngaharmoni jeung tempat tina masyarakat, leuwih bagus ti hukum-hukum anu ditetepkeun ngawasana.
ref: Romantisme boga unsur budaya determinisme anu lega, digambarkeun ku penulis sapertos Goethe, Fischte, jeung Schlegel. Dina kontéks Romantisisme, géografi ngawangun individu. Sinareng antukna adat jeung budaya anu aya hubungannana jeung ieu géografi timbul, maka sagala hal anu disebatkeun tadi saluyu jeung tempat masarakat, langkung saé tibatan hukum anu diberlakukeun sakama-kama.

src: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."
mt: "Determinisme teknologi nyaéta istilah anu ngandung ide-ide leuwih loba, ti tekanologi push atawa imperatif tekanologi nepi ka tekanan nu ngaharapkeun nasib manusa dipicu ku logika anu ngahubungkeun jeung hukum ilmiah sareng manifestasi dina tekanologi. Banyak interpretasi determinisme tekanologi ngabogaan dua ide umum: yén pengembangan tekanologi éta ngahasilkeun jalur anu leuwih loba ti kultura atawa ngaruh politik, jeung tekanologi anu ngahasilkeun "efek" anu ngahubungkeun jeung masyarakat anu ngaharapkeun, anu ngaharapkeun, teu dipicu ku kondisi sosial. Misalna, hiji bisa ngomong yén mobil ngahasilkeun jalur. Aya jalur nasional anu teu ekonomis pikeun hiji tangan mobil, jadi metode-metode produksi anu anyar dipaké pikeun ngurangan biaya pikeun ngabagi mobil. Pemilikan mobil massal ogé ngahasilkeun kasempatan anu luhur pikeun kecelakaan di jalan, anu ngahasilkeun inovasi-inovasi anu anyar dina kesehatan pikeun nyalahkeun badan-badan anu rusak."
ref: "Determinisme téknologi mangrupikeun istilah anu nyakup sababaraha ideu dina praktékna, mimitian ti sorongan téknologi atanapi téknologi teras rarasaan anu kuat yén takdir manusa disorong ku logika dasar anu aya hubunganana sareng hukum ilmiah sareng wujudna dina téknologi. kalolobaan interpretasi determinisme teknologi ngabogaan 2 ide umum: yen pangembangan teknologi eta sorangan ngiring jalan anu kalolobaan di pangaruhan budaya atawa pulitik, sarta yen teknologi dina giliran na ngabogaan ""efek"" dina balarea anu salawasna, batan dikaayaankeun sacara sosial. Contona, manawi hiji jalmi ngecap yen mobil teh peryogi ngarah ka pangembangan jalan. Tapi, jaringan jalan nasional henteu layak sacara ékonomi keur sababaraha mobil hungkul, janten métode anyar dina produksina dikembangkeun pikeun ngirangan biaya kapamilikan mobil. Pamilik mobil masal ogé nyababkeun kacilakaan anu leuwih luhur dina kacilakaan di jalan, ieu ngarahkeun ka panemuan téknik anyar dina perawatan kaséhatan pikeun ngalereskeun awak mobil anu ruksak."

src: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."
mt: "Tanda "up bow" ngan tanda "down bow" nyaéta tanda anu ngagambarkeun bentuk V sareng bentuk tumpeng anu kacida kagantungna. Up ngandung arti anu mibanda tanda éta nyaéta mimiti ti ujung sareng ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunakeun tanda éta, sarta ngagunake
ref: "Lambang panah"" sapertos hurup V sareng ""panah handap"" sapertos tumpukan atanapi kuadrat anu parantos kaleungitan sisi handap. Kaluhur hartosna anjeun kedah mimitian dina ujung sareng nyorong busur na, sareng ka handap hartosna anjeun kedah mimitian dina handap (anu dimana panangan anjeun nyepengan busur) teras narik busur. Gésékan kaluhur téh biasana ngasilkeun sora anu laun lembut upami gésékan ka handap ngasilkeun sora anu tarik teges. Mangga wae upami bade ngagambar ciri anjeun nyalira, tapi emut, ciri melengkung anu tos dicetak ayana kusabab musik, janten biasana kudu dihargaan."

src: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
mt: Unik ti primata séjénna, hominid henteu ngagunakeun tangan pikeun ngalakonan atawa ngarungkakkeun beurat atawa ngagabungkeun di antara pohon. Tangan chimpanzee sareng kaki nyaéta mirip dina ukuran sareng panjang, nujul kana tangan pikeun ngarungkakkeun di antara pohon. Tangan manusa leuwih pendek ti kaki, sareng phalangesna leuwih lurus.
ref: Beda sareng primata anu lainna, hominid henteu nganggo deui leungeunna pikeun gerak atanapi nahan beurat atanapi ayun-ayunan dina tangkal. Leungeun jeung suku simpanse ngabogaan ukuran jeung panjang anu sarua, nyerminkeun pamakéan leungeun kanggo nahan beban keur leumpang maké ramo. leungeun jelema leuwih pondok tibatan sukuna, jeung tulangna leuwih lempeng Tulang panangan fosil yuswana 2 dugi 3 juta warsih ngungkabkeun pergeseran spesialisasi panangan ieu ti penggerak ka manipulasi.

src: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
mt: Penelitian abad ka-20 ngalirikeun yén aya dua kolam variasi genetik: tersembunyi sareng dinyatakeun. Mutasi ngabentuk variasi genetik anyar, sareng seleksi ngahapusna ti kolam variasi genetik dinyatakeun. Segregasi sareng rekombinasi ngabentuk variasi genetik balik ka kolam dinyatakeun sareng sababaraha generasi.
ref: Panalitian abad dua puluh nunjukeun yén aya dua kelompok variasi genetik: anu nyumput sareng muncul. Mutasi téh nambihan jenis génétik nu anyar, teras séléksi ngahapus éta tina kumpulan jenis anu ditunjukkeun. Segregasi sareng kombinasi ulang diacak bulak balik diantara dua kelompok sareng unggal generasi.

src: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."
mt: "Di padang, pikeun primata anu sistim pencernaan kaya manusa, teu gampang pikeun ngahasilkeun kebutuhan asam amino ti sumber tumbuhan anu aya. Sisitem pencernaan anu teu bisa ngahasilkeun éta teu bakal ngabalukarkeun depresi tumbuh, malnutrisi, sareng akhirna kematian. Sumber tumbuhan anu paling aya nyaéta protein anu aya dina daun sareng kacang, tapi éta teu bisa dicerna ku primata kaya manusa kalayan teu dipanggang. Sababaraha hal anu dipikaresep, kana leungeun anu aya dina hama, semut, sareng telur teu ngabalukarkeun pencernaan anu teu gampang, tapi teu ngabalukarkeun protein anu jumlahna luhur sareng ngandung asam amino anu penting. Sababaraha hal anu dipikaresep, kana leungeun anu aya dina hama, semut, sareng telur teu ngabalukarkeun pencernaan anu teu gampang, tapi teu ngabalukarkeun protein anu jumlahna luhur sareng ngandung asam amino anu penting. Sababaraha hal anu dipikaresep, kana leungeun anu aya dina hama, semut, sareng telur teu ngabalukarkeun pencernaan anu teu gampang, tapi teu ngabalukarkeun protein anu jumlahna luhur sareng ngandung asam amino anu penting. Sababaraha hal anu dipikaresep, kana leungeun anu aya dina hama, semut, sareng telur teu ngabalukarkeun pencernaan anu teu gampang, tapi teu ngabalukarkeun protein anu jumlahna luhur sareng ngandung asam amino anu penting. Sababaraha hal anu dipikaresep, kana leungeun anu aya dina hama, semut, sareng telur teu ngabal
ref: Lamun kaluar ti padang, bakal hésé keur monyet nu pencernaanna hampir sarua jiga jelema keur minuhan kabutuhan asam aminona tina sumber daya pelakan nu aya. Selain éta, gagal ngalakukeun hal éta téh ganjaranna serius: mulai depresi, kirang giji, teras akhirna maot. Sumber tutuwuhan anu paling bisa diaksés nyaéta protéin anu tiasa diaksés ku daun sareng kacang, tapi ieu sesah kangge primata sapertos urang nyerna kacuali anu atos di pasak. Sabalikna, daangeun sato (sireum, rinyuh, endog) moal arek babari dicerna, tapi oge nyuplai loba protein anu ngandung kabeh asam amino esensial. Upami tos ngemutan sagala rupi, kedahna urang teu reuwas deui pas terang yen karuhun urang téh kenging protein carana rada mirip sareng carana simpanse dina sabana.

src: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."
mt: "Di padang, pikeun primata anu sistim pencernaan kaya manusa, teu gampang pikeun ngahasilkeun kebutuhan asam amino ti sumber tumbuhan anu aya. Sisitem pencernaan anu teu bisa ngahasilkeun éta teu bakal ngabalukarkeun depresi tumbuh, malnutrisi, sareng akhirna kematian. Sumber tumbuhan anu paling aya nyaéta protein anu aya dina daun sareng kacang, tapi éta teu bisa dicerna ku primata kaya manusa kalayan teu dipanggang. Sababaraha hal anu dipikaresep, kana leungeun anu aya dina hama, semut, sareng telur teu ngabalukarkeun pencernaan anu teu gampang, tapi teu ngabalukarkeun protein anu jumlahna luhur sareng ngandung asam amino anu penting. Sababaraha hal anu dipikaresep, kana leungeun anu aya dina hama, semut, sareng telur teu ngabalukarkeun pencernaan anu teu gampang, tapi teu ngabalukarkeun protein anu jumlahna luhur sareng ngandung asam amino anu penting. src: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
mt: Subkultur ngahimpun individu anu sarua pikiran anu geus kacida dihina ku standar sosial sareng nyadiakeun rasa identitas. Subkultur bisa béda-béda sabab tina umur, étnis, kelas, lokasi, sareng/atawa gender anggotana. Kualitas anu ngahasilkeun subkultur béda bisa béda-béda sabab tina basa, estetika, agama, politik, seks, géografis, atawa campuran faktor. Anggotana subkultur sering ngabédakeun anggotana ku gaya anu béda-béda, anu ngandung fashions, manéh-manéh, sareng argot.
ref: Subkultur ngamajukeun jalma-jalma anu mikiran anu resep anu ngarasa diabaikan ku standar masarakat sareng ngawenangkeun rasa diri. Subkultur dibédakeun gumantung kana yuswana, suku bangsana, kelasna, lokasina, sareng/atanapi génder anggotana. Kualitas anu nangtukeun subkultur salaku bédana panginten basa, éstétis, religius, politik, séks, géografis, atanapi kombinasi faktor. Anggota subkultur mineung nunjukeun tanda kaanggotaan aranjeunna nganggo gaya anu khas sareng simbolis, anu ngacakup pakéan, tingkah laku, sareng argot.

src: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
mt: Anak-anak ngalaman kasadaran ngeunaan ras sareng stereotip ras kawas umurna leuwih muda jeung ieu stereotip ras ngarugikeun tindakan. Pikeun conto, anak-anak anu ngabogaan identitas ras minoritas anu stereotipna teu lulus di sekolah, tiasa teu lulus di sekolah sarta ngalaman ieu stereotip ras.
ref: Barudak ngembangkeun kasadaran ngeunaan ras jeung stereotip ras tileleutik sareng stereotip ieu boga dampak kana kalakuan. Salaku conto, murangkalih anu kalebet ka kaum minoritas dianggap henteu pati saé lamun diajar di sakola, teras saatos aranjeunna apal anggapan nu berhubungan sareng ras éta, aranjeunna bener-bener teu pati pinter di sakolana.

src: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."
mt: Salah sahiji cara paling umum dipaké pikeun ngilustrasikeun pentingna sosialisasi nyaéta ngagunakeun kasus-kasus anu ngajadikeun anak-anak anu ngalaman penolakan, kecelakaan, atawa abus, anu ngabalukarkeun anak-anak éta teu bisa disosialisasikeun ku orangtua. Anak-anak éta disebut "feral" atawa liar. Anak-anak feral bisa dipatén ku manusa (biasana ti orangtua), dina kasus anu lain ngalaman penolakan ti anak-anakna anu ngalaman cacat mental atawa fisik anu parah. Anak-anak feral ogé bisa ngalaman abus atawa trauma anu parah sebelum dipatén atawa kabur. Lain-lain dipikanyaho teu bisa disosialisasikeun ku hewan; anu lain ngalaman dipelihara ku hewan. Anak-anak feral anu dipelihara ku hewan ngalaman perilaku (dalam batas fisik) anu hampir sarua jeung hewan anu ngawulangna, saperti takutna atawa ngalaman kebal terhadap manusa.
ref: "1 metode anu paling umum dipaké pikeun ngagambarkeun pentingna sosialisasi nyaéta ngagunakeun sababaraha kasus barudak miskin, ngaliwatan ngalalaworakeun, kalemahan, atanapi kekerasan anu dihaja, henteu sosialisasi ku urang anu dewasa nalika aranjeunna janten dewasa. Budak anu jiga kitu teh disebat ""liar"" atanapi lingas. loba budak anu lingas sok loba dicarék nu séjén (biasana mah kolotna sorangan); dina sababaraha kasus mah diantepna budak jiga kieu téh kusabab anu jadi kolotna teu tarima kana kaayaan budak anu kurang dina harti kapinteranana atawa kayaan awakna anu henteu sampurna. Barudak liar parantos ngarasakeun dilecehkeun jeung trauma saacan ditinggalkeun atawa kabur. Anu sanésna diduga tos diasuh ku sato; aya anu nyebatkeun hirup di alam liar sosoranganan. Nalika diangkat ku sato sanés ku jalmi, barudak anu liar nunjukkeun tingkah laku (dina wates fisik) ampir sapinuhna sapertos sato anu ngarawatna, sapertos sieunna atanapi acuh ka manusa."

src: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
mt: Subsistence agriculture nyaéta pertanian anu dilakukeun pikeun ngahasilkeun cukup pangan pikeun ngahadapi kebutuhan ti pertanian jeung kulawargana. Subsistence agriculture nyaéta sistem sederhana, kadang-kadang organik, anu ngagunakeun benih disimpan asli ti ecoregion digabungkeun jeung rotasi tanaman atawa téhnik lainna nu relatif sederhana pikeun maksimalisasi hasil. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
ref: Tatanen Subsistén nyaéta tatanén anu dilaksanakeun pikeun ngahasilkeun pangan anu ngan cekap pikeun nyumponan kabutuhan pokona patani sareng kulawargana. Pertanian subsistén mangrupikeun sistem saderhana, seringna organik, anu ngagunakeun bibit nu disimpen asli tina ekoregion digabungkeun sareng rotasi pepelakan atanapi téknik anu kawilang saderhana pikeun maksimalkeun panén. Sajarahna seuseueurna patani téh padamelanna dijadikeun mata pencaharian sareng anu sapertos kieu masih seueur di nagara-nagara berkembang.

src: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.
mt: Turisme anu paling umum nyaéta anu dipikawanoh ku jalma-jalma anu ngalakonan perjalanan: turisme rekreasi. Ieu nyaéta jalma-jalma anu pergi ka tempat anu béda jeung kahirupan harianna pikeun rileks sareng ngalakonan hal-hal anu boga manfaat. Pantai, taman tema sareng tempat camp ground nyaéta tempat anu paling sering dikunjungi ku turis rekreasi. Jika tujuan kunjungan seseorang ka tempat anu béda jeung kahirupan harianna pikeun ngalaman sejarah sareng budaya, ieu tipe turisme disebut turisme budaya. Turis bisa ngalakonan kunjungan ka berbagai tempat bersejarah di suatu negara atawa mungkin mereka hanya memilih untuk fokus pada satu area.
ref: Tiasa wae pariwisata anu umum pisan nyaeta anu osok dihubungkeun jeung mamangkatan: pariwisata rekreasi. Kieu yeuh nalika jalma indit ka hiji tempat anu beda pisan ti asal manehna nu dipake pikeun nyalse jeung neang kabungah Pantai, taman hiburan jeung bumi perkemahan nyaeta tempat anu pangmineungna didatangan ku para wisatawan. Upami tujuan hiji jalma nganjang ka hiji tempat nyaéta mikaweruh sajarah sareng budayana, maka jinis pariwisata ieu katelah wisata budaya. Wisatawan tiasa nyumpingan tempat wisata anu béda di sababaraha nagara atanapi aranjeunna ngan ukur tiasa milih fokus kana hiji daérah.

src: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
mt: Orang-orang anu geus ngalakukeun pikeun sababaraha dasawarsa bantuan kami ngabogaan kana kekuatan sareng pasianna sarta ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ng
ref: Jalma anu parantos terlibat sababaraha puluh taun ngabantosan urang ngahargaan kakuatan sareng kainginan urang bari jeung aranjeunna jujur nganalisa kasusah sareng kagagalan ogé. Nalika ngadangukeun jalma ngabagi carita, kulawarga, sareng organisasina, urang nampi wawasan anu penting ngeunaan jaman baheula sareng sababaraha kapribadian anu mangaruhan hadé atanapi goréng dina budaya organisasi. Upami diajar hiji sajarah henteu berarti ngartos ogé soal budayana, tapi sahenteuna ngabantu jelema keur ngarasa dimana anjeunna aya di sajarah organisasi éta. Nalika meunteun kasuksésan sareng waspada kana kagagalan, individu sarta sadaya jalmi anu miluan mendak leuwih jero ngenaan peunteun, misi, sarta kakiatan pendorong organisasi. Dina perkawis ieu, ngémut conto-conto paripolah wirausaha anu kawit sareng kasuksésan anu dihasilkeun ngabantuan jalmi kanggo kabuka ka parobihan anu anyar sareng arah anyar kanggo garéja lokal. Carita suksés sapertos éta ngurangan rasa sieun kana parobahan, sakaligus nyiptakeun pikiran positif kana parobahan di masa hareup.

src: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
mt: Orang-orang anu geus ngalakukeun pikeun sababaraha dasawarsa bantuan kami ngabogaan kana kekuatan sareng pasianna sarta ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ngabogaan kana kacida ng
ref: Jalma anu parantos terlibat sababaraha puluh taun ngabantosan urang ngahargaan kakuatan sareng kainginan urang bari jeung aranjeunna jujur nganalisa kasusah sareng kagagalan ogé. Nalika ngadangukeun jalma ngabagi carita, kulawarga, sareng organisasina, urang nampi wawasan anu penting ngeunaan jaman baheula sareng sababaraha kapribadian anu mangaruhan hadé atanapi goréng dina budaya organisasi. Upami diajar hiji sajarah henteu berarti ngartos ogé soal budayana, tapi sahenteuna ngabantu jelema keur ngarasa dimana anjeunna aya di sajarah organisasi éta. Nalika meunteun kasuksésan sareng waspada kana kagagalan, individu sarta sadaya jalmi anu miluan mendak leuwih jero ngenaan peunteun, misi, sarta kakiatan pendorong organisasi. Dina perkawis ieu, ngémut conto-conto paripolah wirausaha anu kawit sareng kasuksésan anu dihasilkeun ngabantuan jalmi kanggo kabuka ka parobihan anu anyar sareng arah anyar kanggo garéja lokal. Carita suksés sapertos éta ngurangan rasa sieun kana parobahan, sakaligus nyiptakeun pikiran positif kana parobahan di masa hareup.

src: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.
mt: Kapanggihnaan postmodern ka ngeunaan belajar ngabebaskeun tina abstrak. Tiasa teu aya cara nu bagus pikeun belajar. Faktuna, tiasa teu aya hal nu bagus pikeun belajar.Belajar ngalaman dina antara belajar jeung pangalaman anu dipaparkeun. Pangalamanana dina kana kabéh do-it-yourself jeung informasi anu dipaparkeun, tampilan televisi anu belajar ngabuktikeun hal éta. Sanggeus kitu, sababaraha ti antawisna ngalaman diri salaku nonton televisi anu ngabahas prosés atawa pangalaman anu tiasa teu dipaké atawa dipakékeunna. Kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui, kitu deui,
ref: Pendekatan postmodern kanggo diajar nawarkeun kabébasan ti anu mutlak. Teu aya 1 cara anu pangsaéna kanggo diajar. Faktana heunteu aya ngan hiji hal alus pikeun diajar. Dialajar dimeunangkeun ti pangalaman antara diajar jeung pengetahuan anu disayogikeun. Pangalaman urang nepi ka ayeuna kalawan sadaya acara pigawé sorangan sareng penyajian inpormasi, acara tivi dumasar-diajar ngagambarkeun perkawis ieu. Arurang loba ngarasa dimana keur nongton acara tipi anu méré nyaho urang hiji proses atawa pangalaman anu dimana urang ogé moal bakal ngarasakeun pangalaman éta. Urang moal pernah ngarombak mobil, ngawangun air mancur di halaman tukang, ulin ka Peru keur ningali ruruntuhan kuno, atawa ngarobah imah tatangga urang.

src: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
mt: Interupsi tidur nyaéta prosés ngarangkeun diri awak jadi sadar dina waktu tidur normal jeung jadi sadar deukeutna (10-60 menit). Ieu bisa dilakukeun ku ngagunakeun alarm klok anu ngahasilkeun suara anu teu kacida nyampeungan pikeun ngarangkeun awak jadi sadar tanpa jadi sadar deukeutna. Jika awak ngalakukeun ngarangkeun klok dina tidur, ieu bisa dipindahkeun ka sisi séjén tina kamaharajan, nu ngahasilkeun awak jadi keluar ti kamaharajan pikeun ngarangkeun ieu. Opsi biorhythm-based séjénna ngahasilkeun awak nginum banyan cai (utamana cai atawa teh, diuretik anu kacida nyataan) sebelum tidur, nu ngahasilkeun awak jadi keluar ti kamaharajan pikeun nginum.
ref: Gangguan saré mangrupikeun proses ngahaja hudang salami periode saré normal anjeun sareng saré deui saeunggeus eta dina waktos nu pondok(10-60 menit). Ieu gampil dilakukeun nganggo jam weker nu sepi pikeun ngagugahkeun kasadaran anjeun tanpa bener-bener ngagugahkeun. Upami anjeun ngareset jam nalika bobo, éta jam tiasa disimpen di sisi sanés kamar, éta bakal maksa anjeun kaluar tina ranjang pikeun mareumanana. pilihan anu berdasarkeun Biorythm sejenna nyaeta loba nginum cai(cai herang atau cai teh, anu matak beser) nalika sare, maksa 1 jelema hudang jang papang

src: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.
mt: Orang-orang ngarasa yén ngalami banyan mimpi lucid alami anu sering-sering bisa teuas. Alasannana nyaéta hasil tina mimpi lucid anu ngahasilkeun waktu antara REM anu panjang. Dengan jumlah REM per malam, hal ieu anu ngalaman tina mimpi jeung awakmu ngalaman pikeun ngahasilkeun jadi kaasupan anu teu cukup pikeun jadi masalah. Ieu nyaéta teu leuwih teuas ti yén kalian bangun ti tiap dua puluh atawa tiga puluh menit jeung nonton TV. Efekna terasna tergantung kana bagaimana seringnya otakmu nyoba pikeun mimpi lucid per malam.
ref: Sababaraha jalmi percanten yén sering ngalaman ngimpen sacara sadar anu diinduksi sacara artifisial téh matak capé pisan. Alesan utama ti fénoména ieu nyaéta hasil tina mimpi nu karasa nyata anu ngalébarkeun jangka waktu diantara kondisi REM. Kalayan kirang REMs per wengi, kaayaan anu anjeun bobo sare sareng pamulihan awak anjeun cukup tiasa janten masalah. Ieu sarua capéna jeung upami anjeun hudang unggal dua puluh atanapi tilu puluh menit pikeun nonton TV. Pangaruhna tergantung kana sabaraha sering uteuk anjeun nyobian ngimpi sadar unggal wengi.

src: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
mt: Tim virtual dipaksa ka kualitasna anu sarua jeung tim konvensional, tapi aya perbedaan-perbedaan nu halus. Anggota tim virtual sering kali berfungsi sebagai titik kontak pikeun grup fisikna. Mereka sering kali memiliki lebih banyak otonomi ti anggota tim konvensional sabab timna mungkin ngalakonan pertemuan menurut zona waktu nu mungkin teu dipahami ku manajemennya. Hadirna tim “invisible” (Larson jeung LaFasto, 1989, p109) anu nyata ogé komponen nu unik ti tim virtual. Tim “invisible” nyaéta tim manajemennya pikeun sababaraha anggota. Tim “invisible” ngepalakkeun standar pikeun sababaraha anggota.
ref: "Tim maya diayakeun sesuai jeung standar kualitas anu sami jeung tim konvensional, tapi aya béda na saeutik. Anggota tim maya sering gaduh fungsi janten titik kontak kanggo tim fisik langsung. Aranjeunna gaduh hak otonom nu leuwih tibatan anggota tim konvensional nu séjén kumargi aranjeunna tiasa papendak di zona waktu anu béda-beda anu teu tiasa dipikaharti ku managemen lokal. Ayana ""tim gaib"" nu nyata (Larson sareng LaFasto, 1989, h109) ogé mangrupikeun komponen nu unik tina tim virtual. Tim anu henteu katembong"" nyaeta tim manajemen anu sewang-sewang anggota ngalaporkeun. Tim anu teu katembong netepkeun standar kanggo saban anggota."

src: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
mt: Teori konten ngahasilkeun nu ngahaja atawa nu ngahaja. Teori éta nyaritakeun yen jalma-jalma téh miboga kebutuhan sareng/atawa keinginan anu geus dipikaharkeun ku sababna geus ngalaman pikeun dewasa. Teori éta nempokeun nu ngahaja ti jalma-jalma anu ngahaja nu éta sareng nu anu aya dina lingkungan anu tiasa ngahaja atawa teu ngahaja jalma-jalma nu éta. Dua teori konten nu loba dipaké nyaéta Teori Piramida Kebutuhan Maslow sareng Teori Dua Faktor Hertzberg.
ref: Teori konten dipusatkeun kana milari naon anu nyieun jelema milih atawa menarik keur anjeunna. Téori-téori ieu nunjukeun yén jelema mikaboga kabutuhan sareng/atau kahayang anu dipikayahang ti remaja nepi déwasa. Téori-téori ieu ningalian dina naon anu jalmi-jalmi tertentu hoyong migawé hal nu aranjeunna lakukeun sareng hal naon di sakitaranna nu nyieun aranjeunna ngalakukeun sareng teu ngalakukeun hal tertentu. 2 teori eusi anu populer nyaeta Teori Hirarki dina Kabutuhan Teori sareng 2 Teori Faktor Hertzberg.

src: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
mt: Salah sahijina, format fotografi gambar statis paling umum di dunya nyaéta 35mm, anu jadi format film dominan nalika akhir era film analog. Ieu masih diproduksi hari ieu, tapi anu paling penting, rasio aspekna geus diwariskan ku format sensor kamera digital. Format 35mm ieu, anu ngan pisan-pisan pikeun ngabédakeunna, 36mm leuwih jero ku 24mm. Rasio aspekna ieu (dibagi ku dua belas pikeun ngabentuk rasio sederhana nu bisa dibagi ku dua) nyaéta 3:2. Format umum (APS keluarga format, misalna) nyaéta samentara jeung deukeut rasio aspekna ieu.
ref: Misalna, format fotografi umum pisan di dunya nyaeta anu ukuranna 35 mm. Iyeu ngarupakeun ukuran film anu dominan mirip pisan jeung era film analog. Ieu masih didamel nepikeun ayeuna, nanging nu pangpentingna aspek rasiona tos diwariskeun ti format sensor gambar kamera digital. Format 35mm teh saleresna, rada ngabingungkeun, kusabab legana 36mm jangkungna 24mm . Aspek rasio ti bentuk ieu (dibagi dua belas méh kéngéng rasio bilangan buled nu paling sederhana) nyaéta cenah mah 3:2. Loba format umum (format APS jeung babaturan misalna) sarua atawa mirip jeung aspek rasio iyeu.

src: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.
mt: Kabéh lensa zoom ngalaman kekurangan, nyaéta kompleksitas fokus sareng jumlah lensa anu diperlukan pikeun ngahontal jangkauan fokus leuwih luhur ti lensa anu fokus tetep. Ieu téh jadi kurang jadi masalah, sabab lensa manufaktur ngahontal standar anu luhur dina produksi lensa. Ieu téh ngahontal lensa zoom tiasa ngahasilkeun gambar anu kualitasna sarua jeung lensa anu fokus tetep. Kabéh lensa zoom ogé ngalaman kekurangan, nyaéta maksimum aperture (kecepatan) lensa biasana leuwih luhur. Ieu téh ngahontal lensa zoom murah tiasa teu bisa dipaké dina kondisi cahaya anu luhur tanpa flash.
ref: Kalemahan lensa zum téh nyaéta rumitna pokus sareng sajumlah unsur lensa anu dibutuhkeun pikeun nepi ka rentang panjang pokusna jauh leuwih ageung tibatan lensa nu utama. Ieu ngurangan masalah sabab produsén lénsa ngahontal standar anu langkung dina produksi lénsa. Ieu nu ngamungkinkeun lénsa zoom ngahasilkeun gambar anu kualitas na setanding sareng lénsa panjang fokus tetap. Kakurangan lainna tinu lensa zoom nyaeta bukaan maksimum (kecepatanna) lensa na kadang langkung rendah. Ieu nu matak nyieun lensa jauh mirah sesah dianggo di tempat nu poék tanpa cahaya tambihan.

src: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.
mt: Mytisisme nyaéta pikeun ngalakukeun hubungan jeung, identitas jeung, atawa sadarkeun kana kenyataan akhé, keutamaan, kajadian spiritual, atawa Tuhan. Sang panyaréak ngalakukeun pikeun ngalaman kénéh langsung, intuisi, atawa pangaweruh kana kenyataan akhé/tuhan atawa tuhan-tuhan. Sang panyaréak ngalakukeun cara-cara nu diharapkeun pikeun nganurutkeun éta kénéh. Mytisisme bisa dipisahkeun tina wujud-wujud iman jeung ibadat séjénna ku pangaruhna kana pikeun ngalaman kénéh langsung, intuisi, atawa pangaweruh kana kenyataan akhé/tuhan atawa tuhan-tuhan, nu nyaritakeun kénéh nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu béda, nu
ref: Mistik nyaéta ngausahakeun parsekutuan, identitas, atawa kasadaran kana kanyataan anu luhur, kailahian, kabebeneran spiritual, atawa Gusti. Anu pangagem milarian pangalaman, intuisi, atanapi wawasan anu langsung kana kanyataan ketuhanan/hiji dewa atanapi para dewa. Pengikut hoyong ngajalanan hirupna ku cara tertentu, atanapi praktek anu dimaksudkeun pikeun miara pangalaman éta. kayakinan mistis bisa dibedakeun tinu kayakinan agama sejen ku cara nekenkeun tina pangalaman langsung anu sifatna pribadi tur kaayaan sadar, khsusna dina hal kawilujengan, wawasan nu luas tur kabungahan.

src: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out
mt: Salila lama dina abad ka-19 sareng ka-20, dipercaya yén urang pertama anu ngahuni Selandia Anyar nyaéta urang Maori, anu ngahuni burung gedé anu disebut moa. Teori éta ngahasilkeun ide yén urang Maori ngahuni Polinesia jeung ngahuni Selandia Anyar tina Armada Raksasa, anu ngahuni Selandia Anyar tina urang Moriori, ngahasilkeun hiji masyarakat agraris. Aya bukti anyar anu ngajelaskeun yén urang Moriori nyaéta grup urang Maori anu ngahuni Selandia Anyar ka Pulau Chatham, ngahasilkeun budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, budaya anu béda jeung béda, bud
ref: Kanggo waktos anu lami dina abad ka salapan belas sareng abad ka dua puluhan, dipercaya yén nunyicingan kahiji di New Zealand nyaéta balaréa Maori, anu ngabujeng manuk raksasa anu namina moa. Téori ieu netepkeun ideu bahwasana urang Maori hijrah ti Polinésia dina Great Fleet sareng nyandak Selandia Anyar ti Moriori, ngabentuk masarakat pertanian. Kumaha wae ge, bukti anyar nunjukeun yén Moriori téh nyaéta kelompok ti daratan Maori anu ngalih ti Selandia Baru ka Kepuloan Chatham, ngembangkeun budaya anjeunna nu khas sareng damai. Aya ogé suku anu lian di Pulo Chatham nyaéta Maori anu ngalih ti Selandia Baru. Maranehna nyarebutkeun manehna sorangan Moriori, terus kajadian babaraha pertempuran leutik jeung akhirna Moriori punah.

src: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
mt: Origami pura luhur nyaéta origami anu ngabatasi yen ngagunakeun hiji lipatan sajajar, lipatan anu rumit saperti lipatan balik tiasa teu dipaké, sareng lokasi lipatan tiasa dipikiran. Ieu dipikawanoh ku John Smith dina dasawarsa 1970-an pikeun ngahalang folder anu kurang pahalalan atawa anu kurang kakuatan motor.
ref: pureland Origami nyaéta origami jeung batasan yén hiji lipetan nu tiasa dilakukeun dina hiji waktos, lipetan anu langkung rumit sapertos tilep kabalik tiasa dilakukeun, sareng sadaya lipetan gaduh tempat anu lowong. Ieu téh dikembangkeun ku John Smith dina taun 1970an pikeun ngabantos tukang lipet nu teu gaduh pangalaman atawa ngabantos anu kamampuan motorikna terbatas.

src: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.
mt: Peradaban Sungai Indus nyaéta peradaban peradaban Zaman Perunggu di subbenua India di wewengkon Pakistan, India sareng Afghanistan. Peradaban éta ngahasil di wewengkon sungai Indus, nu jadi asalna ngaran éta. Nu mungkas ngalaporkeun yen peradaban éta ogé aya di wewengkon sungai Sarasvati, nu kiwari teu aya, nu jadi peradaban Indus-Sarasvati, sarta nu séjén ngarujukna minangka peradaban Harappa, nu mimiti dikeueut di taun 1920-an.
ref: Peradaban Landeuh Indus mangrupikeun peradaban Jaman Parunggu di kulon lautna anak buana India anu ngacakup sabagian ageung Pakistan sareng sababaraha daérah di kulon lautna India sareng wétan lautna Afganistan. Peradaban ieu berkembang pesat di kewung Walungan Indus anu timana namina dikéngéngkeun. Sanaos sababaraha sarjana berspekulasi yen margi peradaban oge aya di cekungan Walungan Sarasvati anu ayeuna tuus, eta kedah pas disebut Peradaban Indus-Sarasvati, samentara sababaraha nyebutkeun na Peradaban Harappan sanggeus Harappa, anu kahiji ti loka na anu bade dikali dina 1920-an.

src: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.
mt: Kerakusan sareng pikeun diri ngan bakal aya dina kitaga, jeung éta nyaéta sifatna tina kerja bareng anu nalika loba nu manfaatkeun aya, bakal aya deui nu bakal manfaatkeun dina waktu pendek ku ngalakukeun pikeun diri. Aya harita, loba nu bakal ngertikeun yén pilihan panjangna nyaéta kerja bareng jeung nu séjén.
ref: Kasarakahan sareng kaégoisan bakal salawasna aya di urang sareng éta mangrupikeun sifat kerja sama yén nalika mayoritas diuntungkeun bakal aya terus kauntungan anu di waktos nu singkat upami ngalakukeun hal égois. Semoga sabagian gede jelema nyaladar margi pilihan jangka panyang pangalusna nyaeta gawe bareng jeung batur.

src: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.
mt: Kasusur perang U.S. imperialis dina ngabénténg Filipina di bayar ku rakyat Filipina sorangan. Mereka dipaksa pikeun ngabayar pajak ka régim kolonial U.S. pikeun ngabayar bagian gedé ti kasusur sareng bunga-bunga obligasi anu dipanggihkeun ku bank-bank Wall Street di ngaran pamaréntah Filipina. Tentu, superprofit anu dihasilkeun ku eksploitasi panjang rakyat Filipina téh mangrupa hasil utama U.S. imperialis.
ref: Beaya perang imperialisme AS pas naklukeun Filipina téh dibayar ku warga Filipina sorangan. Aranjeunna dipaksa kedah mayar pajeug ka rezim kolonial A.S pikeun ngabiayaan sabagian ageung pangeluaran sareng bunga obligasi anu ngambang di luhur nami pamaréntah Filipina liwat bank-bank di Wall Street. Tangtosna, kauntungan super anu diturunkeun tina eksploitasi rakyat Filipina anu kapapanjangan bakal janten kauntungan dasar pikeun imperialisme Amerika Serikat.

src: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
mt: Salah sahiji cara pikeun ngahadéan Templar nyaéta ngahadéan konteks nu ngajadikeunna. Zaman nu ngajadikeunna umumna disebut Zaman Tengah Tinggi, périodeu sejarah Eropa dina abad ka-11, ka-12, sareng ka-13 (AD 1000–1300). Zaman Tengah Tinggi diawali ku Zaman Tengah Awal sareng diakhiri ku Zaman Tengah Akhir, nu umumna diakhiri dina taun 1500.
ref: Pikeun ngartos Templars, kedah ngartos heula kontéks anu ngadukung nyptakeun ordo eta. Mangsa kajadian-kajadian ieu biasana disebut  Abad Pertengahan Luhur, jaman sajarah Éropa dina abad ka-11, ka-12, sareng ka-13 (1000–1300 Masehi). Abad Patengahan Luhur ditiheulaan ku Abad Patengahan Awal jeung diteruskeun ku Abad Patengahan Akhir, anu dumasar ka nganyahokeun réngsé sakitar taun 1500.

src: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
mt: Kagiatan militer ti Kaisar Romawi ngalakukeun pikeun ngagabungkeun kana perkembangan anu luhur dina bidang médis. Dokter mulai dipilih ku Kaisar Agustus jeung ogé ngahasilkeun Korps Médis Romawi anu munggaran pikeun dipaké dina pasca perang. Dokter ngahasilkeun pengetahuan ngeunaan beragam sedatif, kaasup morfin tina ekstrak biji papaya jeung skopolamin tina biji herba. Dokter jadi mahir dina amputasi pikeun ngahabarkan pasien tina ganggrena, tourniquet jeung clamp artérial pikeun ngahambat aliran darah. Dina waktu-waktu anu leuwih luhur, Kaisar Romawi ngahasilkeun kana perkembangan anu luhur dina bidang médis jeung ngahasilkeun pengetahuan anu aya sajeroeunna.
ref: Alam militer karajaan Romawi ngabantos perkembangan kamajuan medis. Para dokter mimiti direkrut ku Kaisar Augustus sareng ngadamel Unit Medis Romawi anu mimiti pikeun ngabantu saatos paperangan. Ahli bedah boga pangaweruh ngeunaan rupa-rupa ubar penenang kaasup morfin tina sasari siki poppy jeung skopolamin tina siki herbana. Aranjeunna janten ahli dina amputasi keur nyalametkeun pasién tina gangren jeung turniket jeung jepitan artéri keur ngeureunkeun aliran getih. Pikeun sababaraha abad, karajaan Romawi kéngéng seueur kauntungan dibidang medis sareng nu masihan seueur elmu nu urang terang jaman ayeuna.

src: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."
mt: "Sikhi nyaéta agama ti sub-benua India. Ieu ngabentuk dina abad ka-15 ti pambagian séktar dina tradisi Hindu. Sikhi ngarasa yén ieu nyaéta agama séjén ti Hindu, tapi méré ngalamanana Hindu sareng tradisi. Sikhi ngarujuk agamana jadi Gurmat, anu nyaéta Punjabi pikeun ""jalan guru"". Guru nyaéta aspek nu pangpentingna dina agama-agama India, tapi dina Sikhi ieu ngalamanana jadi pangpentingna dina keyakinan Sikhi. Agama ieu ngabentuk dina abad ka-15 ku Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Sanggeusna, ngalamanana guru ngalamanana 9 guru."
ref: "Sikhisme nyaeta ageman ti anak benua India. Eta asalna di wilayah Punjab salami abad ka-15 ti perpecahan sektarian dina talari Hindu. Sikh nganggap kapercayaanana mangrupikeun agama anu béda tina Hindu sanaos aranjeunna ngaku asal sareng tradisina ti Hindu. Urang Sikh nyebatkeun agamana Gurmat, anu dina basa Punjabi hartosna ""cara guru"". Guru mangrupiken aspek anu mendasar tina sadaya agama India tapi Sikhisme dianggapna penting anu ngawangun inti tina kapercayaan Sikh. Agama ieu diadegkeun dina abad ka-15 ku Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Saterasna aya salapan guru sanés anu ngiringan."

src: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."
mt: Kasus "Kesulitan Perhatian" nyaéta sindrom neurologis anu klasik tina tiga tanda tangan, di antarana impulsif, mudah terganggu, sareng hiperaktif atawa énergi anu teu pati. Éta henteu kasus disabilitas belajar, éta kasus gangguan belajar; éta ngarangkep 3-5 persén ti anak-anak, mungkin 2 juta anak Amerika. Anak-anak nu ngalaman kasus éta teu bisa fokus kana hal-hal anu di antarana karya sekolah, tapi bisa fokus kana hal-hal anu di antarana mainan atawa nonton kartun favoritna atawa nulis kalimat tanpa tanda titik. Anak-anak éta gampang nyerang, sabab éta "mengambil risiko, terlibat dalam pertarungan, sareng menantang otoritas" pikeun merangsang otak, sabab otakna teu bisa merangsang ku cara-cara normal. Kasus ADD ngarangkep hubungan jeung anak-anak séjén sabab anak-anak séjén teu bisa ngerti sababana ngalakonan hal-hal anu di antarana ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep ngarangkep
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""nya éta kelainan dina sistim saraf nu biasana aya ciri-cirina, nya éta dorongan nu kiat, gampil kaganggu, sareng aktif pisan atanapi seueur teuing tenaga"". Ieu sanés teu wasa diajar, ieu mangrupikeun gangguan diajar; ieu ""mangaruhan 3 dugi ka 5 persén murangkalih, mereun aya sakitar 2 juta murangkalih di Amérika"". barudak kalawan ADD ngalaman kahese kanggo fokus dina perkawis-perkawis sepertos pagawean sakola,nanging maranehanana tiasa konsentrasi dina perkawis-perkawis anu maranehanana sukai sepertos ulin game atawa nongton kartun favorit maranehanana atawa nyerat kalimah tanpa tawis maos. Barudak ieu condong ngalaman seueur masalah, sabab ""kalibet dina perilaku anu berisiko, gelut, sareng nangtang aparat"" pikeun ngarangsang otak, sabab otak aranjeunna teu tiasa dirangsang ku cara anu biasa. ADD mangaruhan hubungan sareng babaturan anu sanés kusabab budak anu sanés henteu ngartos naha aranjeunna sapertos kitu atanapi kunaon aranjeunna ngeja sapertos aranjeunna dilakukeun atanapi tingkat kematanganana béda."

src: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.
mt: MySpace nyaéta situs ka-3 pangpopuler nu dipaké di Amerika jeung aya 54 juta profil saacan kiwari. Situs ieu ngahasilkeun perhatian, khususna di lingkungan pendidikan. Aya aspek nu positif tina situs ieu, anu ngajadikeun, bisa lekasan atahur ngalakukeun halaman kelas anu ngandung blog, video, foto, sareng fitur séjénna. Halaman éta bisa lekasan atahur dipaké ku ngabagi hiji alamat web, anu ngahasilkeun éta lekasan atahur gampang dipikirkeun sareng gampang dipikirkeun ku murid anu bisa ngalaman kagagalan dina ngagunakeun papan tiket atawa ngagunakeun ejaan. Bisa dicatukkeun pikeun gampang dipikirkeun sareng ogé jeung warna anu bisa dipaké ku sababaraha atawa nu kurang.
ref: MySpace nyaéta halaman web paling populér katilu anu dianggo di Amerika Serikat sareng jumlah profilna ayeuna aya 54 juta. Situs-situs ieu tos narik seueur perhatian, utamana di bidang atikan. Aya sababaraha aspek positif tina eta  halaman web, nyaeta, jadi gampang ngatur halaman kelas nu tiasa kaasup blog, video, foto, jeung fitur nu lian na. Kaca ieu tiasa gampang diakses ku ngan ukur nyayogikeun 1 alamat wéb, anu matak émut teras gampang diketik kanggo murid anu panginten kasusah ngagunakeun keyboard atanapi nganggo ejaan. Eta tiasa di disaluyukeun meh leuwih gampang dibaca jeung sakalian kirang atanapi langkung dina warnana sakumaha nu di arepkeun.

src: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
mt: Salian ti éta, dina Juni 1956, janji Krushchev diuji nalika aksi damel di Polandia, anu para buruh ngadamel protes tina kacatetan pangan sareng pambagian gaji, jadi protes umum tina komunisme. Anu akhna, Krushchev nyerangkeun tank pikeun ngabangun tata tertib, tapi dia ngalungkeun sababaraha tuntutan ékonomi sareng setuju pikeun ngabéntuk Wladyslaw Gomulka minangka perdana menteri anyar.
ref: nanging, dina sasih Juni taun 1956, jangji na Krushchev teh meunang cocoba nalika aya kajadian karusuhan di Polandia, nalika pagawe protes ngeunaan kakurangan dahareun jeung pangurangan gajih, harita protest eta teh robah jadi protes kana sistim komunis Sanaos akhirna mah, Krushchev ngirim teng baja kanggo nentramkeun, anjeunna ngirim tuntutan ékonomi sareng satuju nunjuk Wladyslaw Gomulka janten pardana menteri nu enggal.

src: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
mt: Jerman jadi musuh umum dina Perang Dunia 2, nu ngabalukarkeun kolaborasi antara Uni Soviet sareng Amérika. Dina akhir perang, konflik antara sistem, prosés sareng budaya ngabalukarkeun dua nagara jadi musuh jeung Perang Dingin dimimitian. Perang éta tiasa ngahadang 40 taun jeung tiasa diparangkeun pikeun nyata, ku pasukan panyerang, di lapangan perang ti Afrika, Asia, Afghanistan, Cuba sareng tempat séjénna.
ref: Jerman mangrupikeun musuh umum dina Perang Dunya 2, anu nuju damel kerjasama antara Uni Soviet sareng AS. Kalayan tungtung perang pasea sistem, proses sareng budaya ngabalukarkeun nagara-nagara murag. Kalayan dua taun ti ahir perang, mantan sekutu ayeuna janten musuh teras Perang Dingin dimimitian. Éta diharapkeun bertahan salami 40 taun ka payun sareng bakal diperjuangkeun sacara nyata, ku pasukan proksi, di medan perang ti Afrika dugi ka Asia, di Apganistan, Kuba sareng seueur tempat sanés.

src: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.
mt: Sistem Saraf ngawengkuan homeostasis ku ngirimkeun impuls saraf ka sakabéh awak pikeun ngatur aliran darah anu ngahasilkeun awak anu aman ti anu bisa jadi ancaman.
ref: Sistem saraf ngajaga homeostasis ku ngirim dorongan saraf ka sakabeh awak pikeun ngajaga getih lancar sareng teu diganggu. Dorongan-dorongan saraf ieu tiasa dikirimkeun kalawan enggal ka sadaya salira, ieu ngajagi salira supados aman ti sagala anceman.

src: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."
mt: "Piramida Géa di Giza nyaéta hiji tina tujuh pemandangan anu masih ngalanggar waktu kiwari. Dibangun ku Mesir dina abad ka-3 SM, Piramida Géa nyaéta hiji tina piramida-piramida gedé anu dibangun pikeun ngarayakan Pharaoh anu mati. Plateau Géa, atawa "Necropolis Géa" di Lembah Mesir anu mati ngandung sababaraha piramida (di antarana piramida gedé), sababaraha kuburan kecil, sababaraha tempat, sareng Sphinx gedé. Piramida gedé dibangun pikeun ngarayakan Pharaoh Khufu, sareng sababaraha piramida, kuburan, sareng tempat anu leutik dibangun pikeun ngarayakan Khufu's istri sareng anggota kulawargana."
ref: "Piramida Ageung di Giza nyaeta hiji-hijina tina 7 kaajaiban anu masih jumeneng ayeuna. Diwangun ku urang Mesir di abad katilu SM, Piramida Agung nyaéta salah sahiji tina réa deui wangunan piramida ageung anu kantos diwangun pikeun ngahormatan Firaun anu maot. Taneuh datar Giza, atau nu disebat ""Giza Necropolis"" anu aya di jero Gawir Mayat Mesir teh loba di eusi ku piramid (anu mana pirawid the great téh nyaéta pang badagna) batu-batu nisan anu laleutik, kuil-kuil, jeung Sphinx. Piramida ageung didamel pikeun ngahargaan ka Firaun Khufu, sareng seueur piramida nu langkung alit, makam sareng candi nu didamel pikeun ngahargaan pamajikan Khufu sareng anggota kulawarga na."

src: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
mt: Tempat pemujaan Artemis di Éfésos dihancurkeun tanggal 21 Juli 356 SM dina hiji tindakan pembakaran anu dilakukeun ku Herostratus. Menurut cerita, motivasna nyaéta pamujaan dina harganya. Para Éfésos, marah, ngumumkeun Herostratus ngan saukur namana anu teu kajadian. Historian Yunani Strabo ngeunaan namana, anu nyaéta cara kita tahu dina kiwari. Tempat pemujaan éta dihancurkeun dina malam harinya Alexander Agung lahir. Alexander, minangka raja, tawaran pikeun ngabangun deh tempat pemujaan éta, tapi tawaranna ditolak. Nalika Alexander tilar dunya, tempat pemujaan éta di bangun deh dina 323 SM.
ref: Kuil Artemis di Ephesus diancurkeun kaping 21 Juli, 356 SM ku aksi pembakaran nu dilakukeun ku Herostratus. Numutkeun carita, motivasina nyaéta kasohor ku cara naon waé. Urang Efesus, babari ambek, ngumumkeun yén nami Herostratus henteu partos dicatet. Sejarawan Yunani satuluyna nyatet ngaranna sapertos anu urang nyaho ayeuna. Kuil dihancurkeun di peuting Aleksander Agung dilahirkeun. Alexander, salaku raja, nawarkeun diri mayar kanggo ngawangun kuil deui, tapi tawaranna ditampik. Teras, saatos Alexander maot, kuilna diwangun deui dina 323 BCE.

src: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
mt: Transportasi munggaran nyaéta jalan kaki, manusa mulai jalan kaki duduk dua juta taun ka tukang dina munculna Homo Erectus (arti manusa duduk dua). Pupusna, Australopithecus teu jalan kaki duduk dua dina hal-hal rutin. Bipedal spesialisasi ditemukan di fosil Australopithecus ti 4,2-3,9 juta taun ka tukang, sanah Sahelanthropus mungkin jalan kaki duduk dua ti tujuh juta taun ka tukang.
ref: Transportasi kahiji anu dipikanyaho nyaeta mapah, jalmi mimiti mapah ajeg 2 juta warsih anu kaliwat kalawan medalna Homo Erectus (hartina jalmi anu ajeg lempeng). Pendahuluna, Australopithecus henteu lempang lempeng sakumaha anu biasana. Spésialisasi dua suku atos ditemukeun dina fosil Australopithecus ramo 4.2-3.9 juta taun ka tukang, sanaos Sahelanthropus manawi atos mapan kalawan 2 suku saprak mimiti dina 7 juta taun katukang.

src: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
mt: Ngagunakeun kapal pikeun ngalakonkeun perdagangan téh jauh pang handapna pikeun ngalakonkeun transportasi rupa-rupa jalma sareng barang di lautan. Tugas tina laut téh tradisionalna nyaéta pikeun nyadiakeun yururut kaasupan pikeun ngalakonkeun transportasi jalma sareng barang kaasupan, sarta samentara ngalanggar yururut kaasupan pikeun ngalakonkeun transportasi jalma sareng barang kaasupan. Salah sahiji conto rékén tina hal éta nyaéta kampanye Atlantik Kalér ti Perang Dunia II. Amérika nyebutkeun pikeun ngalakonkeun transportasi jalma sareng barang kaasupan ka Britania. Samentara, laut Jérman, ngagunakeun kapal selam U, nyebutkeun pikeun ngalanggar transportasi éta. Jika Amérika gagal, Jérman mungkin bakal bisa ngabéntang Britania saperti éta ngabéntang Eropa.
ref: Nganggo kapal pikeun ngangkut barang salami ieu mangrupikeun cara anu paling éfisién pikeun mindahkeun seueur jalma sareng barang meuntas lautan. Pancén soldadu angkatan laut utamina nyaéta kanggo mastikeun nagara mertahankeun kamampuan pikeun mindahkeun balaréa sarta barang-barang, samentara dina waktos anu sami, kedah ngaganggu kamampuan batur mindahkeun balaréa sarta barang-barangna. Salah sahiji conto penting kanggo diemut nyaéta kampanyé Atlantik Kalér ngeunaan Perang Dunia II. Urang Amérika nyoba mindahkeun jalmi jeung barang ngaléwatan samudera Atlantik kanggo nulungan Inggris. Di waktos nu sami, pasukan laut Jerman, seringna make U-boats, keur nyetop kamacétan ieu. Seandaina sekutu gagal, Jérman tiasa waé bakal naklukkeun Inggris sapertos naklukkeun sakumna Éropa.

src: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
mt: Ngagunakeun kapal pikeun ngalakonkeun perdagangan téh jauh pang handapna pikeun ngalakonkeun transportasi rupa-rupa jalma sareng barang di lautan. Tugas tina laut téh tradisionalna nyaéta pikeun nyadiakeun yururut kaasupan pikeun ngalakonkeun transportasi jalma sareng barang kaasupan, sarta samentara ngalanggar yururut kaasupan pikeun ngalakonkeun transportasi jalma sareng barang kaasupan. Salah sahiji conto rékén tina hal éta nyaéta kampanye Atlantik Kalér ti Perang Dunia II. Amérika nyebutkeun pikeun ngalakonkeun transportasi jalma sareng barang kaasupan ka Britania. Samentara, laut Jérman, ngagunakeun kapal selam U, nyebutkeun pikeun ngalanggar transportasi éta. Jika Amérika gagal, Jérman mungkin bakal bisa ngabéntang Britania saperti éta ngabéntang Eropa.
ref: Nganggo kapal pikeun ngangkut barang salami ieu mangrupikeun cara anu paling éfisién pikeun mindahkeun seueur jalma sareng barang meuntas lautan. Pancén soldadu angkatan laut utamina nyaéta kanggo mastikeun nagara mertahankeun kamampuan pikeun mindahkeun balaréa sarta barang-barang, samentara dina waktos anu sami, kedah ngaganggu kamampuan batur mindahkeun balaréa sarta barang-barangna. Salah sahiji conto penting kanggo diemut nyaéta kampanyé Atlantik Kalér ngeunaan Perang Dunia II. Urang Amérika nyoba mindahkeun jalmi jeung barang ngaléwatan samudera Atlantik kanggo nulungan Inggris. Di waktos nu sami, pasukan laut Jerman, seringna make U-boats, keur nyetop kamacétan ieu. Seandaina sekutu gagal, Jérman tiasa waé bakal naklukkeun Inggris sapertos naklukkeun sakumna Éropa.

src: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.
mt: Inventasi roda gigi ngabalukarkeun karéta Assyria leuwih enteng, leuwih cepet sareng leuwih siap pikeun ngalampahkeun pasukan sareng karéta séjénna. Panah-panah nu dongkap dina pamanah téh tiasa nembus acuk zirah prajurit. Pas taun 1000 saacan maséhi, suku Assyrians ngenalkeun pasukan kuda nu kahiji. Pasukan kuda mangrupiken pasukan anu perang dina kuda. Pelana teu acan kapendak, janten pasukan kuda Assyrian perang dina tonggong kuda tanpa alat nanaon.

src: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
mt: Para Babilonia ngeunaan tiap-tiap dewa ngabangun kuil utama anu dianggap rumah ti dewa. Umat ngabawa korban ka dewa sareng imam ngalakukeun upacara sareng pesta. Kuil miboga taman kuil anu terbuka sareng kuil dalam anu ngan imam anu tiasa masuk. Kadang-kadang, piramid anu bentukna tumpang tindih, disebut ziggurat, di bangun pikeun jadi bagian ti kuil. Atap ti tower anu khusus kuil pikeun dewa.
ref: Urang Babilon ngawangun kuil utama pikeun masing-masing déwa sareng dianggap imahna dewa. Jalma-jalma bakal nawiskeun pangorbanan ka déwa sareng pendeta bakal ngusahakeun nyumponan kabutuh para déwa lewat upacara sareng festival. Setiap kuil kagungan halaman kuil anu terbuka teras tempat panangtayungan anu ngan para imam anu tiasa asup. Kadang babaraha menara anu gaduh wujud sapertos piramid, disebut ziggurat. Ziggurat diwangun salaku bagian tina kuil. Puncak menarana nyaeta tempat istimewa pikeun Tuhan.
